SDTM_DATASET.label: Pharmacokinetics Concentrations

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the procedure or test page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim medication name that is either preprinted or collected on a CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reported Agent Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGTRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: If AGTRT is modified to facilitate coding, then AGMODIFY will contain the modified text.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Modified Reported Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGMODIFY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of AGTRT or AGMODIFY. Equivalent to the generic medication name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary, then AGDECOD will be left blank.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standardized Agent Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGDECOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of agent. Examples: "CHALLENGE AGENT", "PET TRACER".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Further categorization of agent.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific agent was solicited on the CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: AG Pre-Specified
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGPRESP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: When the use of specific agent is solicited, AGOCCUR is used to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") use of the agent occurred. Values are null for agents not specifically solicited.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: AG Occurrence
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGOCCUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question about a prespecified agent was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the reason a response to a question about the occurrence of a procedure agent was not collected. Used in conjunction with AGSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Procedure Agent Not Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, follow guidance in Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit AGCLAS.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Agent Class
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGCLAS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Class code corresponding to AGCLAS. Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class code. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, follow guidance in Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit AGCLASCD.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Agent Class Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGCLASCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Amount of AGTRT taken.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose per Administration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGDOSE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Units may be stored in AGDOSU. Examples: "200-400", "15-20".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Description
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGDOSTXT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Units for AGDOSE and AGDOSTXT. Examples: "ng", "mg", "mg/kg".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGDOSU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dose form for AGTRT. Examples: "TABLET", "AEROSOL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Form
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGDOSFRM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of AGDOSE within a specific time period. Example: "ONCE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGDOSFRQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Route of administration for AGTRT. Example: "ORAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Route of Administration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGROUTE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. \n 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. \n 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the agent administration started.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the agent administration started.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by AGTRT and the dosing variables began.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by AGTRT and the dosing variables ended.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of start of agent relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of end of agent relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration for an agent episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration of Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the start of the agent relative to sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into AGSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSTRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the end of the agent relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into AGENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGENRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the start of the agent as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable AGSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSTRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AGSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGSTTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the end of the agent as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AGENTPT. Identifies the end of the agent as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable AGENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGENRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AGENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGENTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Example: a number preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: line number on a concomitant medication page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim medication name that is either preprinted or collected on a CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMTRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: If CMTRT is modified to facilitate coding, then CMMODIFY will contain the modified text.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Modified Reported Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMMODIFY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of CMTRT or CMMODIFY. Equivalent to the generic drug name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary, then CMDECOD will be left blank.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standardized Medication Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDECOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of medications/treatment. Examples: "PRIOR", "CONCOMITANT", "ANTI-CANCER MEDICATION", "GENERAL CONMED".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Medication
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of medications/treatment. Examples: "CHEMOTHERAPY", "HORMONAL THERAPY", "ALTERNATIVE THERAPY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Medication
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific medication was solicited on the CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: CM Pre-specified
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMPRESP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: When the use of a specific medication is solicited. CMOCCUR is used to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") use of the medication occurred. Values are null for medications not specifically solicited.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: CM Occurrence
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMOCCUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question about the occurrence of a prespecified intervention was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with CMSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Medication Not Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Denotes why a medication was taken or administered. Examples: "NAUSEA", "HYPERTENSION".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Indication
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMINDC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit CMCLAS.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Medication Class
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMCLAS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Class code corresponding to CMCLAS. Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class code. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit CMCLASCD.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Medication Class Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMCLASCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Amount of CMTRT given. Not populated when CMDOSTXT is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose per Administration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDOSE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Units may be stored in CMDOSU. Examples: "200-400", "15-20". Not populated when CMDOSE is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Description
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDOSTXT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Units for CMDOSE, CMDOSTOT, or CMDOSTXT. Examples: "ng", "mg", "mg/kg".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDOSU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dose form for CMTRT. Examples: "TABLET", "LOTION".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Form
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDOSFRM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of CMDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: "BID" (twice daily), "Q12H" (every 12 hours).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDOSFRQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Total daily dose of CMTRT using the units in CMDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as total daily dose. Total dose over a period other than day could be recorded in a separate supplemental qualifier variable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Total Daily Dose
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDOSTOT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Example: "TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Intended Dose Regimen
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDOSRGM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Route of Administration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMROUTE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted. Examples: "ADVERSE EVENT", "INSUFFICIENT RESPONSE", "NON-MEDICAL REASON".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMADJ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: When dosing of a treatment is recorded over multiple successive records, this variable is applicable only for the (chronologically) last record for the treatment.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason the Intervention Was Discontinued
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMRSDISC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the medication administration started. Null for medications that started before study participation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the medication administration. Null for medications that started before study participation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of the medication administration represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Medication
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of the medication administration represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Medication
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of start of medication relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Medication
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of end of medication relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Medication
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration for a treatment episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the start of the medication relative to sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR" was collected, this information may be translated into CMSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSTRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the end of the medication relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING, or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into CMENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMENRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the start of the medication as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable CMSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSTRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by CMSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMSTTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the end of the medication as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable CMENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMENRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by CMENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CMENTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related, grouped records across domains.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the intervention treatment known to the subject and/or administrator.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECTRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Mode or condition of the record specifying whether the intervention (activity) is intended to happen or has happened. Values align with BRIDG pillars (e.g., scheduled context, performed context) and HL7 activity moods (e.g., intent, event). Examples: "SCHEDULED", "PERFORMED".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Mood
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECMOOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related ECTRT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category of Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of ECCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory of Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used when a specific intervention is prespecified. Values should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pre-Specified
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECPRESP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether a treatment occurred when information about the occurrence is solicited. ECOCCUR = "N" when a treatment was not taken, not given, or missed.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Occurrence
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECOCCUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The reason for the value in --OCCUR. If --OCCUR = "N", this is the reason the exposure did not occur.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason for Occur Value
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECREASOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Amount of ECTRT when numeric. Not populated when ECDOSTXT is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDOSE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Amount of ECTRT when non-numeric. Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Example: "200-400". Not populated when ECDOSE is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Description
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDOSTXT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Units for ECDOSE, ECDOSTOT, or ECDOSTXT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDOSU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dose form for ECTRT. Examples: "TABLET", "LOTION".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Form
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDOSFRM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of ECDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: "Q2H", "QD", "BID".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDOSFRQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Total daily dose of ECTRT using the units in ECDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as total daily dose.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Total Daily Dose
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDOSTOT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of the intended schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Example: "TWO WEEKS ON", "TWO WEEKS OFF".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Intended Dose Regimen
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDOSRGM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Route of administration for the intervention. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Route of Administration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECROUTE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lot number of the ECTRT product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lot Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECLOT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Specifies location of administration. Example: "ARM", "LIP".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location of Dose Administration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of the intervention administration. Examples: "LEFT", "RIGHT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL", "UPPER".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of). Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Portion or Totality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECPORTOT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Examples: "Y", "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Fasting Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECFAST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Amount of an active ingredient expressed quantitatively per dosage unit, per unit of volume, or per unit of weight, according to the pharmaceutical dose form.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pharmaceutical Strength
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECPSTRG

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for ECPSTRG. Examples: "mg/TABLET", "mg/mL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pharmaceutical Strength Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECPSTRGU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes reason or explanation of why a dose is adjusted.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason for Dose Adjustment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECADJ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Trial epoch of the exposure as collected record. Examples: "RUN-IN", "TREATMENT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by ECTRT and ECDOSE began.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The date/time when administration of the treatment indicated by ECTRT and ECDOSE ended. For administrations considered given at a point in time (e.g., oral tablet, pre-filled syringe injection), where only an administration date/time is collected, ECSTDTC should be copied to ECENDTC as the standard representation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of ECSTDTC relative to the sponsor-defined DM.RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECSTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of ECENDTC relative to the sponsor-defined DM.RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration of administration. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration of Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when administration should occur. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See ECTPTNUM and ECTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of ECTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time relative to the planned fixed reference (ECTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by ECELTM, ECTPTNUM, and ECTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by ECTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ECRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains.
