SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MLTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to the planned fixed reference (MLTPTREF). This variable is useful when there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MLELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by MLELTM, MLTPTNUM, and MLTPT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MLTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by MLTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MLRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name of a specific instance of a disease milestone type (MIDSTYPE) described in the Trial Disease Milestones dataset. This should be unique within a subject. Used only in conjunction with RELMIDS and MIDSDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Disease Milestone Instance Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIDS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The temporal relationship of the observation to the disease milestone instance name in MIDS. Examples: "IMMEDIATELY BEFORE", "AT TIME OF", "AFTER".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Temporal Relation to Milestone Instance
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RELMIDS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The start date/time of the disease milestone instance name in MIDS, in ISO 8601 format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Disease Milestone Instance Date/Time
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIDSDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: preprinted line identifier on a CRF, record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to facilitate identification of relationships between records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to facilitate identification of relationships between records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of procedure performed, either preprinted or collected on a CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reported Name of Procedure
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRTRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived name of PRTRT. If the codelist "PROCEDUR" is not used, the sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms in the external codelist element in the Define-XML document. If an intervention term does not have a decode value, then PRDECOD will be null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standardized Procedure Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDECOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of procedure values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of PRCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used when a specific procedure is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pre-specified
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRPRESP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to record whether a prespecified procedure occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific procedure is solicited.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Occurrence
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PROCCUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Denotes the indication for the procedure (e.g., why the procedure was performed).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Indication
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRINDC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Amount of PRTRT administered. Not populated when PRDOSTXT is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDOSE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dosing information collected in text form. Examples: "<1", "200-400". Not populated when PRDOSE is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Description
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDOSTXT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Units for PRDOSE, PRDOSTOT, or PRDOSTXT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDOSU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dose form for PRTRT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Form
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDOSFRM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Usually expressed as the number of doses given per a specific interval.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDOSFRQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of the intended schedule or regimen for the procedure.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Intended Dose Regimen
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDOSRGM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Route of administration for PRTRT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Route of Administration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRROUTE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of a procedure.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location of Procedure
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Portion or Totality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRPORTOT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the procedure.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of the procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Procedure
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of the procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Procedure
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of start of procedure expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Procedure
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRSTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of end of procedure expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Procedure
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration of a procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration of Procedure
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a procedure should be performed. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PRTPTNUM and PRTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 format relative to a planned fixed reference (PRTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by PRELTM, PRTPTNUM, and PRTPT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by PRTRTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable PRSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRSTRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by PRSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRSTTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable PRENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRENRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by PRENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PRENTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Tobacco & Alcohol Use CRF page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Substance name. Examples: "CIGARETTES", "COFFEE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reported Name of Substance
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUTRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: If SUTRT is modified, then the modified text is placed here.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Modified Substance Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUMODIFY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of SUTRT or SUMODIFY if the sponsor chooses to code the substance use. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standardized Substance Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUDECOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "TOBACCO", "ALCOHOL", or "CAFFEINE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Substance Use
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of substance use. Examples: "CIGARS", "CIGARETTES", "BEER", "WINE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Substance Use
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether ("Y"/null) information about the use of a specific substance was solicited on the CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: SU Pre-Specified
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUPRESP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: When the use of specific substances is solicited, SUOCCUR is used to indicate whether ("Y"/"N") a particular prespecified substance was used. Values are null for substances not specifically solicited.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: SU Occurrence
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUOCCUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: When the use of prespecified substances is solicited, the completion status indicates that there was no response to the question about the prespecified substance. When there is no prespecified list on the CRF, then the completion status indicates that substance use was not assessed for the subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the reason substance use was not collected. Used in conjunction with SUSTAT when value of SUSTAT is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Substance Use Not Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Substance use class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4.2.8.3, Multiple Values for a Non-result Qualifier Variable, or omit SUCLAS.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Substance Use Class
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUCLAS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Code corresponding to SUCLAS. May be obtained from coding.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Substance Use Class Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUCLASCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Amount of SUTRT consumed. Not populated if SUDOSTXT is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Substance Use Consumption
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUDOSE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Substance use consumption amounts or a range of consumption information collected in text form. Not populated if SUDOSE is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Substance Use Consumption Text
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUDOSTXT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Units for SUDOSE, SUDOSTOT, or SUDOSTXT. Examples: "oz", "CIGARETTE", "PACK", "g".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Consumption Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUDOSU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dose form for SUTRT. Examples: "INJECTABLE", "LIQUID", "POWDER".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dose Form
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUDOSFRM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of SUDOSE within a specific time period. Example: "Q24H" (every day).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Use Frequency Per Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUDOSFRQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Total daily use of SUTRT using the units in SUDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as total daily dose. If a sponsor needs to aggregate the data over a period other than daily, then the aggregated total could be recorded in a supplemental qualifier variable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Total Daily Consumption
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUDOSTOT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Route of administration for SUTRT. Examples: "ORAL", "INTRAVENOUS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Route of Administration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUROUTE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the substance use started. Null for substances that started before study participation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the substance use. Null for substances that started before study participation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of the substance use represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Substance Use
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of the substance use represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Substance Use
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of start of substance use relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Substance Use
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of end of substance use relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Substance Use
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration of substance use in ISO 8601 format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration of Substance Use
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the start of the substance use relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR" was collected, this information may be translated into SUSTRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSTRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the end of the substance use with relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING", or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into SUENRF. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUENRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the start of the substance as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable SUSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7 , Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSTRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by SUSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUSTTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the end of the substance as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable SUENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7 , Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUENRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by SUENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUENTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A sequence of characters used by the sponsor to uniquely identify a specific device. Used to represent a device associated in some way with the adverse event. SPDEVID values are defined in the Device Identifiers (DI) domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SPDEVID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external identifier such as a serial number on an SAE reporting form.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. It may be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on an Adverse Events CRF page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AETERM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: If AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Modified Reported Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEMODIFY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the lowest level term.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lowest Level Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AELLT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived code for the lowest level term.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lowest Level Term Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AELLTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived text description of AETERM or AEMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEDECOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived code for the preferred term.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Preferred Term Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEPTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the high level term for the primary system organ class (SOC).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: High Level Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEHLT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived code for the high level term for the primary SOC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: High Level Term Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEHLTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the high level group term for the primary SOC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: High Level Group Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEHLGT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived code for the high level group term for the primary SOC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: High Level Group Term Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEHLGTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "BLEEDING", "NEUROPSYCHIATRIC".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AECAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of adverse event. Example: "NEUROLOGIC".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A value of "Y" indicates that this adverse event was prespecified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pre-Specified Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEPRESP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary derived. Body system or organ class used by the sponsor from the coding dictionary (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Body System or Organ Class
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEBODSYS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary derived. Code for the body system or organ class used by the sponsor. When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Body System or Organ Class Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEBDSYCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the primary SOC. Will be the same as AEBODSYS if the primary SOC was used for analysis.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Primary System Organ Class
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived code for the primary SOC. Will be the same as AEBDSYCD if the primary SOC was used for analysis.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESOCCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event (e.g., "ARM" for skin rash).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location of Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AELOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: "MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Severity/Intensity
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESEV

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Is this a serious event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Serious Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESER

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes changes to the study treatment as a result of the event. AEACN is specifically for the relationship to study treatment. AEACNOTH is for actions unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Examples of AEACN values include ICH E2B values: "DRUG WITHDRAWN", "DOSE REDUCED", "DOSE INCREASED", "DOSE NOT CHANGED", "UNKNOWN" and "NOT APPLICABLE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEACN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Usually reported as free text. Example: "TREATMENT UNBLINDED. PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN NOTIFIED".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Other Action Taken
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEACNOTH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: An action taken with a device as the result of the event. The device may or may not be a device under study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Action Taken with Device
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEACNDEV

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH does not establish any required or recommended terms for non-device relatedness. ICH E2A and E2B examples include (up-cased here for alignment to SDTM conventions) terms such as "NOT RELATED", "UNLIKELY RELATED", "POSSIBLY RELATED", "RELATED", but these example terms do not establish any conventions or expectations. Controlled terminology may be defined in the future. Check with regulatory authority for population of this variable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Causality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEREL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description:
A judgment as to the likelihood that the device caused the adverse event. The relationship is to a device identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Relationship of Event to Device
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AERLDEV

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AERELNST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: "INTERMITTENT", "CONTINUOUS", "SINGLE EVENT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pattern of Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEPATT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the outcome of an event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Outcome of Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEOUT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Was the serious event associated with the development of cancer? Valid values are "Y" and "N". This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Involves Cancer
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESCAN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Was the serious event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESCONG

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Did the serious event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESDISAB

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Did the serious event result in death? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Results in Death
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESDTH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Did the serious event require or prolong hospitalization? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESHOSP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Was the serious event life-threatening? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Is Life Threatening
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESLIFE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Did the serious event occur with an overdose? Valid values are "Y" and "N". This is a legacy seriousness criterion. It is not included in ICH E2A or E2B.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Occurred with Overdose
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Do additional categories for seriousness apply? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESMIE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Records whether medical or surgical intervention was necessary to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or to prevent permanent damage to a body structure, with either situation suspected to be due to the use of a medical product. This variable is used in conjunction with the other "seriousness" variables (e.g., fatal, life-threatening). It is part of the US federal government definition of a serious adverse event; see 21 CFR Part 803.3(w)(3).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Needs Intervention to Prevent Impairment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESINTV

SDTM_VARIABLE.description:
Any serious adverse effect on health or safety or any life-threatening problem or death caused by or associated with a device, if that effect, problem, or death was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the investigational plan or application (including a supplementary plan or application), 
 or 
 any other unanticipated serious problem associated with a device that relates to the rights, safety, or welfare of subjects. (21 CFR Part 812.3(s)). 
 This variable applies only to serious AEs and should hold collected data; if the value is derived, it should be held in ADaM.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unanticipated Adverse Device Effect
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEUNANT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description:
The investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event as related to other protocol-required activities, actions, or assessments (e.g., medication changes, tests/assessments, other procedures). The relationship is to a protocol-specified, non-device-related activity where the device is identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AERLPRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description:
The investigator's opinion as to the likelihood that the device-related study procedure (e.g., implant/insertion, revision/adjustment, explant/removal) caused the AE. The relationship is to a device-related procedure where the device is identified in the data (i.e., has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. 
 Terminology: 
 * In the EU, follow the European Commission Guidelines on Medical Devices, Clinical Investigations: SAE Reporting (MEDDEV 2.7/3) (e.g., Not Related, Unlikely, Possible, Probable, Causal Relationship), with device-specific definitions. 
 * No required Controlled Terminology in US.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AERLPRC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Was another treatment given because of the occurrence of the event? Valid values are "Y" and "N".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AECONTRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Toxicity grade according to a standard toxicity scale (e.g., Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, CTCAE). Sponsors should specify the name of the scale and version used in the metadata (see assumption 7d). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2", not "Grade 2").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AETOXGR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the adverse event. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of the adverse event represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of the adverse event represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of start of adverse event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AESTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of end of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration and unit of an adverse event. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. Example: "P1DT2H" (for 1 day, 2 hours).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration of Adverse Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point (RFSTDTC) and a discrete ending point (RFENDTC) of the trial. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEENRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AEENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEENRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AEENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AEENTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SPDEVID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BESEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external identifier for the specimen affected or created by the event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional sponsor-defined reference number. Example: Line number on a CRF page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BESPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Topic variable for an event observation, which is the verbatim or pre-specified name of the event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reported Term for the Biospecimen Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BETERM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: If the value for BETERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Modified Reported Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEMODIFY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived text description of BETERM or BEMODIFY, if applicable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEDECOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: COLLECTION, PREPARATION, TRANSPORT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Biospecimen Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BECAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of BECAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Biospecimen Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the anatomical location relevant for the event (e.g. BRAIN, LUNG).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Anatomical Location of Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BELOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Party accountable for the transferable object (e.g. specimen) as a result of the activity performed in the associated BETERM variable. The party could be an individual (e.g., subject), an organization (e.g., sponsor), or a location that is a proxy for an individual or organization (e.g., site). It is usually a somewhat general term that is further identified in the BEPRTYID variable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Accountable Party
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEPARTY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identification of the specific party accountable for the transferable object (e.g. Specimen) after the action in BETERM is taken. Used in conjunction with BEPARTY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Identification of Accountable Party
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEPRTYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date and time of specimen collection.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of the event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Biospecimen Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BESTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of the event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Biospecimen Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Biospecimen Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BESTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Biospecimen Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration and unit of a biospecimen event. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration of Biospecimen Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BEDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to link together a block of related records for a subject within a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external identifier (e.g., lab specimen ID, UUID for an ECG waveform or medical image).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Term for the medical condition or event. Most likely preprinted on CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reported Term for the Clinical Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CETERM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Controlled terminology for the name of the clinical event. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEDECOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for the Clinical Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CECAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of the condition or event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for the Clinical Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether the event in CETERM was prespecified. Value is "Y" for prespecified events and null for spontaneously reported events.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Clinical Event Pre-specified
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEPRESP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used when the occurrence of specific events is solicited, to indicate whether or not a clinical event occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Clinical Event Occurrence
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEOCCUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The status indicates that a question from a prespecified list was not answered.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the reason clinical event data was not collected. Used in conjunction with CESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Clinical Event Not Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary-derived. Body system or organ class that is involved in an event or measurement from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Body System or Organ Class
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEBODSYS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: "MILD", "MODERATE", "SEVERE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Severity/Intensity
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESEV

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Toxicity grade according to a standard toxicity scale (e.g., Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) v3.0). Sponsor should specify name of the scale and version used in the metadata. If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2", not "Grade 2").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CETOXGR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the clinical event started.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the clinical event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time for the clinical event observation represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Event Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of the clinical event represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Clinical Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of the clinical event, represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Clinical Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of clinical event collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Event Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of start of the clinical event expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of end of the clinical event expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the start of the clinical event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESTRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Period
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEENRF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable CESTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESTRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by --STRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CESTTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable CEENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEENRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by CEENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CEENTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Disposition page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the event or protocol milestone. Some terms in DSTERM will match DSDECOD, but others, such as "Subject moved", will map to controlled terminology in DSDECOD, such as "LOST TO FOLLOW-UP".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reported Term for the Disposition Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSTERM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Controlled terminology for the name of disposition event or protocol milestone. Examples of protocol milestones: "INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED", "RANDOMIZED". There are separate codelists used for DSDECOD where the choice depends on the value of DSCAT. Codelist "NCOMPLT" is used for disposition events, codelist "PROTMLST" is used for protocol milestones, and codelist "OTHEVENT" is used for other events.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standardized Disposition Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSDECOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Disposition Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of DSCAT (e.g., "STUDY PARTICIPATION", "STUDY TREATMENT" when DSCAT = "DISPOSITION EVENT"). The variable may be subject to controlled terminology for other categories of disposition event records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Disposition Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the event.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of the disposition observation represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of the disposition event in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Disposition Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of collection of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of start of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Disposition Event
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DSSTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DVSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DVREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DVSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the protocol deviation criterion. Example: "IVRS PROCESS DEVIATION - NO DOSE CALL PERFORMED". DVTERM values will map to the controlled terminology in DVDECOD (e.g., "TREATMENT DEVIATION").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Protocol Deviation Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DVTERM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Dictionary or sponsor-defined derived text description of HOTERM or the modified topic variable (HOMODIFY).

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the healthcare encounter. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP".

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of the healthcare encounter.

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable --STTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.

SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MHENRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by MHENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MHENTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Biospecimen Test Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: MEASUREMENT, QUALITY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Biospecimen Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of BSCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Biospecimen Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for BSORRES. Examples: mg, mL.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from BSORRES in a standard format or standard units. BSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in BSSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from BSSTRESC. BSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for BSSTRESC and BSSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a test was not done, or was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with BSSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Test Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE, SOFT TISSUE.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the specific anatomical or biological region of a tissue, organ specimen or the region from which the specimen is obtained, as defined in the protocol, such as a section or part of what is described in the BSSPEC variable. Examples: CORTEX, MEDULLA, MUCOSA.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Anatomical Region of Specimen
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSANTREG

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the condition of the specimen. Examples: HEMOLYZED, ICTERIC, LIPEMIC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSSPCCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: SPECTROPHOTOMETRY, ELECTROPHORESIS.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date and time of specimen collection.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of specimen collection relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See BSTPTNUM and BSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of BSTPT used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (BSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by BSELTM, BSTPTNUM, and BSTPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by BSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BSRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external specimen identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the lab page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CPTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CPTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). CPTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MONO", "MNS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test or Examination Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name for CPTESTCD. For cell phenotyping, the name (often abbreviated) of the cell population, as it is generally accepted by the scientific community, is populated (rather than a colloquial designation based on a primary marker, e.g., TLym Help rather than CD4). When the test is for a sublineage which can only be identified by specifying additional markers (i.e., has not been given a name) or which is further restricted to a subpopulation based on a particular cell state (e.g., activated, proliferating, apoptotic), the Sublineage Marker String (CPSBMRKS), Cell State (CPCELSTA), and Cell State Marker String (CPCSMRKS) variables are additionally populated and the value in CPTEST is suffixed with "Sub" to denote that it is a subset of the population identified in CPTEST (e.g., Monocytes Sub). \n The value in CPTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to further subset the cell population identified in CPTEST based on the use of additional marker(s) that define a sublineage. The value in CPSBMRKS is used in combination with values in CPTEST and CPCELSTA to fully describe the cell population being measured. As such, it is an essential component of the full test name. \n For example, three unnamed sublineages of monocytes have been identified as: CCR2+CD16-, CCR2-CD16+, and CCR2+CD16+. Whereas the entire monocyte cell population can be defined as CD14+ cells, the additional CCR2 and CD16 markers are used to differentiate one sublineage from another. As none of these sublineages have been given names, they are only known by the CCR2 and CD16 marker combinations. By associating the CPTEST value of "Monocytes Sub" with, for example, a value of "CCR2+CD16-" in CPSBMRKS, the full test is defined to be the CCR2+CD16- monocyte subpopulation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sublineage Marker String
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSBMRKS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A textual description of a subset of the cell population identified in CPTEST based on a particular functional and/or biological state (e.g., "ACTIVATED", "PROLIFERATING", "SENESCENT"). When populated, the values in CPCELSTA and CPSMRKS, in combination with the values in CPTEST and CPSBMRKS, fully describe the cell population being measured.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Cell State
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPCELSTA

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the marker(s) or indicator(s) used to define the cell state (i.e., the value in CPCELSTA). \n For example, when Ki67 expression is used to determine that a cell population is in a proliferating state (i.e., CPCELSTA value="PROLIFERATING"), the value "Ki67+" in CPCSMRKS indicates that positive expression of Ki67 was used to define the population as proliferating. Similarly, a value of "Ki67-" in CPCSMRKS would indicate that lack of expression of Ki67 defined the "NON-PROLIFERATING" cell state in CPCELSTA. The CPCSMRKS value is useful for quickly determining which marker(s) were used to classify (i.e., operationally define) a cell population based on a functional/biological state.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Cell State Marker String
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPCSMRKS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed. --TSTCND is generally used to distinguish between two or more records where the same assay is performed under varying (as opposed to fixed) conditions, usually for the purpose of making a comparison. For example, when the same assay (identified in --TEST) is performed under stimulated and non-stimulated conditions, the --TSTCND variable is used distinguish between the records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPTSTCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The textual description of the agent, if applicable, used to impose the condition identified in CPTSTCND. For example, records might be produced for the same assay run under stimulating (CPTSTCND value = "STIMULATED") conditions produced by different stimulating agents (e.g., phorbol myristate acetate, concanavalin A, PHA-P, TNF-alpha, Ionomycin, candida antigen).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Condition Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPCNDAGT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The textual description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the CPTEST variable. The CPBDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the CPTEST and CPBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n The binding agent may be, but is not limited to, a test article; a portion of a test article; a substance related to a test article; an endogenous molecule; an allergen; an infectious agent; or a reagent (e.g., primary antibody) that confers the binding specificity for the measurement defined in CPTEST when it is needed to uniquely identify the test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Binding Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPBDAGNT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the antibody clone (e.g., supplier-provided catalog name) used to confer specificity for the binding agent specified in CPBDAGNT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Antibody Clone Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPABCLID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The text string identifying the full set of markers/indicators used by the laboratory to operationally define the complete test based on the combination of CPTEST, CPSBMRKS, and CPCELSTA. Because laboratories often use different markers/indicators to identify a cell population, the relationship between a named cell population in CPTEST (as combined with CPSBMRKS and CPCELSTA values) and the set of markers used to identify that population is many-to-one. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different sets of markers, it is necessary to operationally define the test in terms of the complete set of markers/indicators used to perform that test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Marker String
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPMRKSTR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The sponsor-defined name assigned to a gate. Gates are electronic (i.e., a device setting or software-defined) boundaries set by a user to virtually parse a specimen into discrete populations based on a set of defined characteristics (e.g., presence, absence, or intensity of expression of various markers; physical size; internal complexity or granularity). Gates are used to constrain data collection or analysis to a specific cell population or region of interest within the specimen.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Gate
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPGATE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The text string identifying the set of parameters and the order in which they are applied to define the gating strategy. In practice, a series of 2-dimensional sub-gates based on different cell characteristics (i.e., markers/indicators/physical properties) are most often combined until the cell population of interest is sufficiently resolved (i.e., electronically isolated) from other cell populations contained within the specimen. \n For complex analyses, differences in gating strategies can produce subtle differences in results obtained for a test. To ensure nuances important for accurately interpreting the data are accounted for and which arise from the use of different gating strategies, it is often necessary to qualify the test in terms of the gating strategy. For some purposes, however, and at the discretion of the sponsor, only the ultimate or penultimate gate is identified. When specifying the gating strategy in CPGATDEF, each sub-gate should be listed in the order it was applied and separated from the next sub-gate using the pipe/vertical line ("|") character.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Gate Definition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPGATDEF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor's description of a test. The variable is intended to contain highly structured test description metadata used by a sponsor to unambiguously define (label) a test. Such values generally reside in a sponsor/laboratory test metadata repository. CPSPTSTD is not intended for unstructured (spontaneous) free text. \n An example of appropriate usage is when it is necessary to include identifying information for a target cell population on which a test is conducted when the target population is not part of the test name, e.g., tests for quantitative expression of a particular marker on a specific cell population.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor Test Description
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSPTSTD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects. Examples: "IMMUNOPHENOTYPING", "CELL FUNCTION", "TARGET ENGAGEMENT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of CPCAT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined textual description used to group tests run together as part of a test panel. Can be used with --GRPID to ensure that relationships between associated tests are accurately identified.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Panel
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPTSTPNL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for CPORRES. Examples: "10^6/L", "%", "MESF".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Classifies the scale of the original result value with respect to whether the result is quantitative, ordinal, nominal, or narrative.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Scale
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPRESSCL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Classifies the kind of result (i.e., property type) originally reported for the test. Examples: "NUMBER CONCENTRATION", "NUMBER FRACTION", "RATIO".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPRESTYP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate the type of collected summary result. This includes source summary results collected on a CRF or provided by an external vendor (e.g., central lab). If the summary result is derived using individual source data records, this summary result should be represented in ADaM. If a sponsor has both a collected summary result and a derived summary result, the collected summary result should be represented in SDTM and the derived summary result should be represented in ADaM.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Collected Summary Result Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPCOLSRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPORNRLO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPORNRHI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from CPORRES in a standard format or in standard units. CPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in CPSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from CPSTRESC. CPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for CPSTRESC or CPSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for CPSTRESC/CPSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSTNRLO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSTNRHI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by CPORNRLO and CPORNRHI, CPSTNRLO and CPSTNRHI, or by CPSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether CPNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. CPNRIND should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Indicator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPNRIND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that the test was not performed or that it was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null if a result exists in CPORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a test was not performed, e.g., "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED", "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with CPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name or identifier of the laboratory that performed the test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Code for the test from the LOINC code system. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: LOINC Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPLOINC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "BLOOD", "BONE MARROW".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The physical state or quality of a specimen for an assessment. Example: "CLOTTED".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPSPCCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Example: "FLOW CYTOMETRY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Analysis Method
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPANMETH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets. If CPDRVFL = "Y", then CPORRES may be null, with CPSTRESC and (if numeric) CPSTRESN having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgement.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPCLSIG

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of specimen collection, measured in integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC value in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a specimen is to be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (i.e., to the value in CPTPTREF). Example: "1 hour post".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of CPTPT to aid in sorting. When CPTPT is represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (i.e., to the value in CPTPTREF), the values in CPTPTNUM should be assigned in ascending order relative to the value in CPTPTREF.
