For example, records for time points where CPTPT = "5 minutes post", 1 hour post", and "4 hours post" could be represented in CPTPTNUM as "1", "2", and "3", which maintains the order between CPTPT and CPTPTNUM with respect to the fixed time point reference in CPTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time relative to the planned fixed reference value in CPTPTREF, represented in ISO 8601 duration format. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent 15 minutes prior to the reference time point indicated by CPTPTREF, "T8H" to represent 8 hours after the reference time point represented by CPTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Descriptive name of the fixed reference point referred to by CPTPT, CPTPTNUM, and CPELTM. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by CPTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CPRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional internal or external identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: a preprinted line identifier on a CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in CVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in CVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" would not be valid). CVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Cardiovascular Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name For CVTESTCD. The value in CVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Cardiovascular Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Cardiovascular Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of CVCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Cardiovascular Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Position of Subject During Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVPOS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. Unit for CVORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived, from CVORRES in a standard format or in standard units. CVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in CVSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in CVORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in CVSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from CVSTRESC. CVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for CVSTRESC and CVSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed (e.g., "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED"). Used in conjunction with CVSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "HEART", "LEFT VENTRICLE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location Used for the Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL", "UNILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method used to create the result.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that CVBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (i.e., a record that represents the average of other records, such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", " INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in CVEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of an observation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See CVTPTNUM and CVTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (CVTPTREF). Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL". This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by CVELTM, CVTPTNUM, and CVTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by CVTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CVRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study within the submission.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DASEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DAGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional internal or external identifier such as a code from the product packaging (e.g., bottle label, package label, kit label).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DAREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Examples: Line number on the Product Accountability CRF page, a code from the product packaging (e.g., bottle label, package label, kit label).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DASPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DALNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DALNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short character value for DATEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters and cannot begin with a number or contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "DISPAMT", "RETAMT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Accountability Assessment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DATESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name corresponding to the topic variable of the test or examination used to obtain the product accountability assessment. The value in DATEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Dispensed Amount", "Returned Amount".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Accountability Assessment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DATEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "STUDY MEDICATION", "RESCUE MEDICATION".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DACAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization level for a group of related records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DASCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the product accountability assessment as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DAORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for DAORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DAORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all product accountability assessments copied or derived from DAORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. DASTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in DASTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DASTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from DASTRESC. DASTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DASTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for DASTRESC and DASTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DASTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a product accountability assessment was not done. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DASTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with DASTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DAREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit, based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm (see Section 7.2.1, Trial Arms).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date and time of the product accountability assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DADTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of product accountability assessment, measured in integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DADY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in DDTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in DDTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). DDTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "PRCDTH", "SECDTH".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Death Detail Assessment Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name for DDTESTCD. The value in DDTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Primary Cause of Death", "Secondary Cause of Death".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Death Detail Assessment Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the test defined in DDTEST, as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding as Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result or finding copied or derived from DDORRES in a standard format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Examples: "TREATMENT RELATED", "NONTREATMENT RELATED", "UNDETERMINED", "ACCIDENTAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDRESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of collection of the diagnosis or other death assessment data in ISO 8601 format. This is not necessarily the date of death.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DDDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SPDEVID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external ECG identifier. Example: "334PT89".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: ECG Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the ECG page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A sequence number that identifies the beat within an ECG.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: ECG Beat Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGBEATNO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in EGTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in EGTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). EGTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "PRAG", "QRSAG". \n Test codes are in 2 separate codelists, 1 for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGTESTCD) and one 1 tests based on Holter monitoring (HETESTCD).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: ECG Test or Examination Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in EGTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "PR Interval, Aggregate", "QRS Duration, Aggregate". \n Test names are in 2 separate codelists, 1 for tests based on regular 10-second ECGs (EGTEST) and 1 for tests based on Holter monitoring (HETEST).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: ECG Test or Examination Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize ECG observations across subjects. Examples: "MEASUREMENT", "FINDING", "INTERVAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for ECG
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of the ECG.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for ECG
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: ECG Position of Subject
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGPOS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the ECG measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples of expected values are "62" or "0.151" when the result is an interval or measurement, or "ATRIAL FIBRILLATION" or "QT PROLONGATION" when the result is a finding.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for EGORRES. Examples: "sec", "msec".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from EGORRES, in a standard format or standard units. EGSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in EGSTRESN. For example, if a test has results of 62 beats/min, then EGORRES = "62", EGORRESU = "beats/min", EGSTRESC = "62", EGSTRESN = 62, and EGSTRESU = "beats/min" . For other examples, see Original and Standardized Results. Additional examples of result data: "SINUS BRADYCARDIA", "ATRIAL FLUTTER", "ATRIAL FIBRILLATION". \n Test results are in 3 separate codelists: EGSTRESC for abnormal test results based on regular 10-second ECGs; HESTRESC for abnormal test results based on Holter monitoring, and NORMABNM for generic test results and/or responses to EGTEST = "Interpretation".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from EGSTRESC. EGSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for EGSTRESC and EGSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate an ECG was not done, or an ECG measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in EGORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with EGSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason ECG Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: File name and path for the external ECG waveform file.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: ECG External File Path
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGXFN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor providing the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the ECG test. Example: "12-LEAD STANDARD".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The lead used for the measurement. Examples: "LEAD 1", "LEAD 2", "LEAD rV2", "LEAD V1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lead Location Used for Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGLEAD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that EGBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If EGDRVFL="Y", then EGORRES could be null, with EGSTRESC and EGSTRESN (if the result is numeric) having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in EGEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST 1" or "RADIOLOGIST 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGCLSIG

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Repetition Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGREPNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/Time of ECG.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of ECG
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the ECG, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of ECG
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See EGTPTNUM and EGTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of EGTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (EGTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by EGELTM, EGTPTNUM, and EGTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by EGTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EGRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional internal or external identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the Test page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short character value for FTTEST, which can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). FTTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. \n Controlled terminology for FTTESTCD is published in separate codelists for each instrument. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/terminology/controlled-terminology for values for FTTESTCD. Examples: "W250101", "W25F0102".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the question used to obtain the finding. The value in FTTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n Controlled terminology for FTTEST is published in separate codelists for each instrument. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/terminology/controlled-terminology for values for FTTEST. Examples: "W2501-25 Foot Walk Time", "W25F-More Than Two Attempts".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to specify the functional test in which the functional test question identified by FTTEST and FTTESTCD was included.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of FTCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Position of the subject during the test. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Position of Subject During Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTPOS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. Unit for FTORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from FTORRES in a standard format or in standard units. FTSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in FTSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from FTSTRESC. FTSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for FTSTRESC and FTSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Used in conjunction with FTSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: File path to an external file.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: External File Path
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTXFN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the vendor or laboratory that provided the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A baseline defined by the sponsor (could be derived in the same manner as FTLOBXFL or ABLFL, but is not required to be). The value should be "Y" or null. Note that FTBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Repetition Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTREPNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the functional tests finding.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of functional test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of test expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken, as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See FTTPTNUM and FTTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (FTTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by FTELTM, FTTPTNUM, and FTTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by FTTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FTRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SPDEVID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Non-Host Organism Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NHOID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A unique identifier for the assayed genetic specimen.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in GFTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in GFTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). GFTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Genomic Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name for GFTESTCD. The value in GFTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Genomic Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of a reportable qualifying the assessment in GFTESTCD and GFTEST.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Measurement, Test, or Examination Detail
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFTSTDTL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Genomic Finding
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of GFCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Genomic Finding
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for GFORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reference value for the result or finding as originally received or collected. GFORREF uses the same units as GFORRES, if applicable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Result in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFORREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from GFORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. GFSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in GFSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from GFSTRESC. GFSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for GFSTRESC, GFSTRESN, GFSTREFC, and GFSTREFN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reference value for the result or finding copied or derived from GFORREF in a standard format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Result in Standard Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSTREFC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reference value for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format or in standard units. GFSTREFN uses the same units as GFSTRESN, if applicable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSTREFN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFRESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies whether the variation can be passed to the next generation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inheritability
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFINHERT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: An identifier for the genome reference used to generate the reported result. For example, Genome Reference Consortium Human Build 38 patch release 13 may be represented as "GRCh38.p13".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Genome Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFGENREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The designation (name or number) of the chromosome or contig on which the variant or other feature appears (e.g., "17"; "X").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Chromosome Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFCHROM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A published symbol for the portion of the genome serving as a locus for the experiment/test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Genomic Symbol
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSYM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A description of the type of genomic entity that is represented by the published symbol in GFSYM.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Genomic Symbol Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSYMTYP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Specifies the location within a sequence for the observed value in GFORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Genetic Location
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFGENLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The portion of the locus in which the variation was found. Examples: "Exon 15", "Kinase domain".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Genetic Sub-Region
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFGENSR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A unique identifier for the sequence used as the reference to identify the genetic variation in the result. Examples: "NM_001234", "ENSG00000182533", "ENST00000343849.2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Identifier \n
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSEQID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A unique identifier for the variation that has been publicly characterized in an external database. Examples: "rs2231142", "COSM41596".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Published Variant Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFPVRID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: An arbitrary identifier used to differentiate between copies of a genetic target of interest present on homologous chromosomes.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Copy Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFCOPYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with GFSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Test Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The filename and/or path to external data not stored in the same format and possibly not the same location as the other data for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: External File Path
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFXFN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the vendor that provided the test result. When more than 1 vendor is involved in the generation of the result, additional vendors should be represented as supplemental qualifiers.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the type of genetic material used for the measurement.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Material Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The test method by which the examination is performed by the wet lab in order to yield the result reported in the dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A unique identifier for a particular run of a test performed by the wet lab on a particular batch of samples. This identifier can be used to distinguish between records for the same test performed at different times.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Run ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFRUNID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The method of secondary processing performed by the dry lab to yield the result reported in the dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Analysis Method
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFANMETH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for GFSTRESU.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFLLOQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test performed by the wet lab.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Repetition Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFREPNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date and time of specimen collection.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See GFTPTNUM and GFTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of GFTPT used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (GFTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by GFELTM, GFTPTNUM, and GFTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by GFTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: GFRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IESEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Inclusion or exclusion criteria number from CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IESPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the criterion described in IETEST. The value in IETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). IETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "IN01", "EX01".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IETESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim description of the inclusion or exclusion criterion that was the exception for the subject within the study. IETEST cannot be longer than 200 characters.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IETEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IECAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of the exception criterion. Can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or for to categorize as a major or minor exceptions. Examples: "MAJOR", "MINOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original response to inclusion/exclusion criterion question, i.e., whether the inclusion or exclusion criterion was met.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: I/E Criterion Original Result
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IEORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Response to inclusion/exclusion criterion result, in standard format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: I/E Criterion Result in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IESTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the inclusion/exclusion finding.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of the inclusion/exclusion criterion represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IEDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of collection of the inclusion/exclusion exceptions, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IEDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Non-host Organism ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NHOID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: "458975-01".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in ISTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in ISTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). ISTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Immunogenicity Test/Exam Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in ISTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Immunoglobulin E".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Immunogenicity Test or Examination Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISTSTCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The textual description of the agent used to impose a test condition. Examples are different stimulating agents used in immunoassays such as those in the Interferon Gamma Response assay (e.g., Mycobacterium tuberculosis ESAT-6, CFP-10, TB 7.7, Mitogen).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Condition Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISCNDAGT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the ISTEST variable. ISBDAGNT is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the ISTEST and ISBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n ISBDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the 2 entities in ISTEST and ISBDAGNT. In other words, the combination of ISTEST and ISBDAGNT should describe the entity or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be (but is not limited to) a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, an endogenous molecule, an allergen, or an infectious agent.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Binding Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISBDAGNT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level. If populated, valid values are "SCREEN", "CONFIRM", and "QUANTIFY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Operational Objective
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISTSTOPO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of the entity secreted by the cells represented in ISTEST. The combination of ISTEST and ISMSCBCE should describe the entity or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Molecule Secreted by Cells
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISMSCBCE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Further description of ISTESTCD and ISTEST.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Detail
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISTSTDTL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects. Example: "SEROLOGY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Immunogenicity Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of ISCAT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Immunogenicity Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Results or Findings in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for ISORRES. Examples: "Index Value", "gpELISA", "unit/mL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISORNRLO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISORNRHI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from ISORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. ISSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in ISSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from ISSTRESC. ISSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Results/Findings in Std. Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for ISSTRESC and ISSTRESN. Examples: "Index Value", "gpELISA", "unit/mL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for ISSTRESC/ISSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSTNRLO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSTNRHI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: For normal range values that are character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. Examples: "-1 to +1", "NEGATIVE TO TRACE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range for Char Rslt-Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSTNRC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by ISORNRLO and ISORNRHI, ISSTNRLO and ISSTNRHI, or by ISSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". \n Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether ISNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. \n Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Indicator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISNRIND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a test was not done. Should be null if a result exists in ISORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Used in conjunction with ISSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provided the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the types of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SERUM".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSPCCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be "N" if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Usability for the Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISSPCUFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "ELISA", "ELISPOT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that ISBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets include those that represent the average of other records, do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected. If ISDRVFL="Y", then ISORRES may be null, with ISSTRESC and (if numeric) ISSTRESN having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for ISSTRESU.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISLLOQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of an observation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of the observation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See ISTPTNUM and ISTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of ISTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (ISTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by ISTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by ISTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by ISELTM, ISTPTNUM, and ISTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of the reference time point, ISTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ISRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: specimen ID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the Lab page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in LBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in LBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). LBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "ALT", "LDH".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lab Test or Examination Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Note: Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in LBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Alanine Aminotransferase", "Lactate Dehydrogenase".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies any planned condition imposed by the assay system on the specimen at the time the test is performed.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTSTCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The textual description of the agent that is binding to the entity in the LBTEST variable. The LBBDAGNT variable is used to indicate that there is a binding relationship between the entities in the LBTEST and LBBDAGNT variables, regardless of direction. \n LBBDAGNT is not a method qualifier. It should only be used when the actual interest of the measurement is the binding interaction between the 2 entities in LBTEST and LBBDAGNT. In other words, the combination of LBTEST and LBBDAGNT should describe the thing, the entity, or the analyte being measured, without the need for additional variables. \n The binding agent may be (but is not limited to) a test article, a portion of the test article, a related compound, or an endogenous molecule.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Binding Agent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBBDAGNT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of the high-level purpose of the test at the operational level.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Operational Objective
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTSTOPO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects. Examples: "HEMATOLOGY", "URINALYSIS", "CHEMISTRY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Lab Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of a test category. Examples: "DIFFERENTIAL", "COAGULATION", "LIVER FUNCTION", "ELECTROLYTES".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for LBORRES. Example: "g/L".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Classifies the scale of the original result value; for example, whether the result is ordinal, nominal, quantitative, or narrative.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Scale
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBRESSCL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Classifies the kind of result (i.e., property type) originally reported for the test. Examples include substance concentration, proportion, mass rate, and arbitrary concentration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBRESTYP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate the type of collected summary result. This includes source summary results collected on a CRF or provided by an external vendor (e.g., central lab). If the summary result is derived by the sponsor using individual source data records from SDTM, the derived summary result is represented in ADaM. If the summary result is produced and reported by the lab, the collected summary result is represented in SDTM.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Collected Summary Result Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBCOLSRT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBORNRLO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurement in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBORNRHI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The lowest threshold (as originally received or collected) for reliably detecting the presence or absence of substance measured by a specific test. The value for the field will be as described in documentation from the instrument or lab vendor.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lower Limit of Detection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBLLOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from LBORRES in a standard format or standard units. LBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in LBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in LBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in LBSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see Original and Standardized Results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from LBSTRESC. LBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for LBSTRESC or LBSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for LBSTRESC/LBSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSTNRLO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSTNRHI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: For normal range values that are character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. Examples: "-1 to +1", "NEGATIVE TO TRACE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range for Char Rslt-Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSTNRC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI, LBSTNRLO and LBSTNRHI, or by LBSTNRC. Examples: "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL", "HIGH", "LOW". Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the Define-XML document) whether LBNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. LBNRIND is not used to indicate clinical significance.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Range Indicator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBNRIND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate exam not done. Should be null if a result exists in LBORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED", or "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with LBSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Test Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name or identifier of the laboratory that performed the test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Code for the lab test from the LOINC code system. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: LOINC Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBLOINC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The physical state or quality of a sample for an assessment. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSPCCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the usability of the specimen for the test. The value will be "N" if the specimen is not usable, and null if the specimen is usable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Usability for the Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBSPCUFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EIA" (enzyme immunoassay), "ELECTROPHORESIS", "DIPSTICK".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g., a calculation used to measure eGFR).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Analysis Method
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBANMETH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The sensitivity of the test methodology with respect to observation, detection, or quantification.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Method Sensitivity
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTMTHSN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that LBBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Examples: "Y", "N".
