SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Fasting Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBFAST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets. If LBDRVFL="Y", then LBORRES may be null, with LBSTRESC and (if numeric) LBSTRESN having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR. The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Toxicity
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTOX

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Records toxicity grade value using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., the NCI CTCAE). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2" not "Grade 2"). The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTOXGR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBCLSIG

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of specimen collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See LBTPTNUM and LBTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of LBTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (LBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable. Represented as ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by LBELTM, LBTPTNUM, and LBTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of the reference time point, LBTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: An indication that the specimen was collected at a single point in time. The value is "Y" or null. The intent of this variable in the LB domain is to aid mapping to LOINC codes in the dataset, when LOINC part "Time Aspect" = "Pt".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Point in Time Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBPTFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned duration of specimen collection. If LBPTFL is "Y" then LBPDUR is null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Duration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LBPDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed. The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FOCID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external specimen identifier (e.g., sample ID for a subject sample from which a microbial culture was generated).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, it may be used to link genetic findings (in the PF domain) about a microbe to the original culture of that microbe (in MB), or to susceptibility records (in MS) if needed.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or finding described in MBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MCORGIDN" for Microbial Organism Identification "GMNCOC" for Gram Negative Cocci.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Microbiology Test or Finding Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Microbial Organism Identification", "Gram Negative Cocci", "HIV-1 RNA".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Microbiology Test or Finding Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Further description of MBTESTCD and MBTEST. Example: "VIRAL LOAD" when MBTESTCD represents viral genetic material, such as "HCRNA", "QUANTIFICATION" when MBTESTCD represents any organism being quantified.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Measurement, Test or Examination Detail
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBTSTDTL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of MBCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the microbiology measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples for "GRAM STAIN" findings: "+3 MODERATE", "+2 FEW", "<10". Examples for "CULTURE PLATE" findings: "KLEBSIELLA PNEUMONIAE", "STREPTOCOCCUS PNEUMONIAE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original unit for MBORRES. Example: "mcg/mL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from MBORRES, in a standard format or standard units. MBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "+3 MODERATE", "MOD", and "MODERATE" in MBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MBSTRESC as "MODERATE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MBSTRESC. MBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for MBSTRESC and MBSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding in a standard format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBRESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or that a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MBSTAT when value is NOT DONE. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable (e.g., lab test).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: LOINC Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBLOINC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SPUTUM", "BLOOD", "PUS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Material Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Example: "CONTAMINATED".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBSPCCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location relevant to the collection of the measurement.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Collection Location
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for specimen collection location further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for specimen collection location further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "GRAM STAIN", "MICROBIAL CULTURE, LIQUID", "QUANTITATIVE REVERSE TRANSCRIPTASE POLYMERASE CHAIN REACTION".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that MBBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Fasting Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBFAST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element which the specimen collection occurred.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of specimen collection.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the specimen collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See MBTPTNUM and MBTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of MBTPT used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (MBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by MBTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by MBTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by MBELTM, MBTPTNUM, and MBTPT. Example: "PREVIOUS DOSE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point, MBTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MBRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject. This is not the treatment group number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: specimen barcode number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: line number from the MI Findings page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in MITEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MITESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MITESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "HER2", "BRCA1", "TTF1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Microscopic Examination Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MITESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MITEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2", "Breast Cancer Susceptibility Gene 1", "Thyroid Transcription Factor 1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Microscopic Examination Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MITEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Further description of the test performed in producing the MI result. This would be used to represent specific attributes, such as intensity score or percentage of cells displaying presence of the biomarker or compound.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Microscopic Examination Detail
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MITSTDTL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Microscopic Finding
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MICAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of MICAT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Microscopic Finding
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the histopathology measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original unit for MIORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MIORRES in a standard format or standard units. MISTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MISTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MISTRESC. MISTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for MISTRESC and MISTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. Examples: "MALIGNANT" or "BENIGN" for tumor findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIRESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate examination not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in MIORRES or have a value of "NOT DONE" when MIORRES = "NULL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MISTAT when value is NOT DONE. Examples: "SAMPLE AUTOLYZED", "SPECIMEN LOST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MINAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Subject of the observation. Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "TISSUE", "BLOOD", "BONE MARROW".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Material Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Example: "AUTOLYZED".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MISPCCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Location relevant to the collection of the specimen. Examples: "LUNG", "KNEE JOINT", "ARM", "THIGH".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Collection Location
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MILOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for laterality of the location of the specimen in MILOC. Examples: "LEFT", "RIGHT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Laterality within Subject
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MILAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for directionality of the location of the specimen in MILOC. Examples: "DORSAL", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Directionality within Subject
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. This could include the technique or type of staining used for the slides. Examples: "IHC", "Crystal violet", "Safranin", "Trypan blue", or "Propidium iodide".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MILOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that MIBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Example: "PATHOLOGIST", "PEER REVIEW", "SPONSOR PATHOLOGIST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of specimen collection, in ISO 8601 format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of specimen collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional internal or external identifier such as lab specimen ID or a medical image.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: Preprinted line identifier on a Concomitant Medications page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short character value for MKTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in MKTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MKTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "TNDRIND", "SWLLIND", "SGJSNSCR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Musculoskeletal Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name For MKTESTCD. Examples: "Tenderness Indicator", "Swollen Indicator", "Sharp/Genant JSN Score".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Musculoskeletal Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "SWOLLEN/TENDER JOINT ASSESSMENT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Musculoskeletal Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of MKCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Musculoskeletal Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Position of Subject
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKPOS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for MKORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MKORRES in a standard format or in standard units. MKSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MKSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in MKORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MKSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MKSTRESC. MKSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for MKSTRESC and MKSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or that a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null if a result exists in MKORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MKSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "INTERPHALANGEAL JOINT 1", "SHOULDER JOINT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location Used for the Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "X-RAY", "MRI", "CT SCAN".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that MKBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in MKEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of an observation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See MKTPTNUM and MKTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned Elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (MKTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by MKELTM, MKTPTNUM, and MKTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by MKTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MKRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the TEST. This variable should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the non-host organism as reported by a lab (e.g., "A/California/7/2009 (H1N1)"). It is not to be used as a qualifier of the result in the record on which it appears.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Non-host Organism ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NHOID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. In SDTMIG v3.2 this was an Expected variable. In this version, the core designation has been changed to Permissible.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional internal or external identifier (e.g., an identifier for the culture/isolate being tested for susceptibility).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, it may be used to link genetic findings (in the PF domain) about a microbe to the original culture of that microbe (in MB), or to susceptibility records (in MS) if needed.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short character value for MSTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in MSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). MSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MIC" for Minimum Inhibitory Concentration; "MICROSUS" for Microbial Susceptibility.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Assessment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in MSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Minimum Inhibitory Concentration", "Microbial Susceptibility".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Assessment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name of the agent for which resistance is tested. The agent specified may be based on genetic markers or direct phenotypic drug sensitivity testing. Examples: "Penicillin", name of study drug.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Agent Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSAGENT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric concentration of agent listed in MSAGENT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Agent Concentration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSCONC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Units for value of the agent concentration listed in MSCONC. Example: "mg/L".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Agent Concentration Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSCONCU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Further description of MSTESTCD and MSTEST.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Measurement, Test or Examination Detail
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSTSTDTL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of MSTEST values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of MSCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for MSORRES. Examples: "ug/mL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from MSORRES in a standard format or in standard units. MSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in MSSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in MSORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in MSSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from MSSTRESC. MSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for MSSTRESC and MSSTRESN. Example: "mol/L".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by MSORNRLO and MSORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N", "HIGH", "LOW", "NORMAL". "ABNORMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSNRIND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding. In SDTMIG v3.2, MSRESCAT was used to categorize a numeric susceptibility result represented in MSORRES as either "SUSCEPTIBLE", "INTERMEDIATE", or "RESISTANT". However, results from some susceptibility tests may report only a categorical result and not a numeric result. Thus, in order for susceptibility results to be represented consistently, MSRESCAT should no longer be used for this purpose. In this version, the core designation has been changed from Expected to Permissible.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSRESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with MSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Filename for an external file.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: External File Path
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSXFN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes (LOINC) code for the topic variable such as a lab test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: LOINC Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSLOINC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SPUTUM".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Material Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the condition of the specimen. Example: "CLOUDY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSSPCCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location Used for the Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EPSILOMETER", "MACRO BROTH DILUTION".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result (e.g., an image or a genetic sequence).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Analysis Method
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSANMETH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that MSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status. Valid values include "Y", "N", "U", or null if not relevant.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Fasting Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSFAST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "MICROSCOPIST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in MSEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1" or "RADIOLOGIST2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: In cases where more than 1 assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Accepted Record Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSACPTFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for MSSTRESU.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSLLOQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates the upper limit of quantitation for an assay. Units will be those used for MSSTRESU.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Upper Limit of Quantitation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSULOQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Repetition Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSREPNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the specimen was collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the specimen was collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of an observation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See MSTPTNUM and MSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (MSTPTREF; e.g., previous dose, previous meal). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by MSELTM, MSTPTNUM, and MSTPT. Example: "PREVIOUS DOSE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by MSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding MSTESTCD. Example: "-P2M" to represent a period of the past 2 months before the assessment.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluation Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSEVLINT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluation Interval Text
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MSEVINTX

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1") or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back"). The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FOCID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external procedure identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number from the Procedure or Test page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link a procedure to the assessment results over the course of the study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in NVTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in NVTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). NVTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SUVR", "N75LAT", "P100LAT","N145LAT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Nervous System Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in NVTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Standard Uptake Value Ratio", "N75 Latency", "P100 Latency", "N145 Latency".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Nervous System Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "VISUAL EVOKED POTENTIAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Nervous System Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of NVCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Nervous System Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the procedure measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for NVORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from NVORRES, in a standard format or standard units. NVSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in NVSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from NVSTRESC. NVSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for NVSTRESC or NVSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a test was not done, or a measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in NVORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with NVSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "BRAIN", "EYE", "PRECUNEUS", "CINGULATE CORTEX".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location Used for the Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "EEG", "PET/CT SCAN ", "FDGPET".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that NVBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in NVEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date of procedure or test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the procedure or test, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See NVTPTNUM and NVTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of NVTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (NVTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by NVTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by NVTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by NVELTM, NVTPTNUM, and NVTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by --TPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NVRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen as called out in the protocol for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Focus of Study-Specific Interest
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FOCID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OELNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OELNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short character value for OETEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in OETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). OETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "NUMLCOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OETESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name for the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in OETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Number of Letters Correct" for OETESTCD = "NUMLCOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OETEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Further description of OETESTCD and OETEST.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Ophthalmic Test or Exam Detail
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OETSTDTL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Examples: "VISUAL ACUITY", "CONTRAST SENSITIVITY", "OCULAR COMFORT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Ophthalmic Test or Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OECAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of OECAT values. Example: "HIGH CONTRAST" or "LOW CONTRAST" when OECAT is "VISUAL ACUITY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Ophthalmic Test or Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: "120", "<1, NORMAL", "RED SPOT VISIBLE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original unit for OEORRES. Examples: "mm", "um".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for results stored in OEORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEORNRLO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for results stored in OEORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEORNRHI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from OEORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. OESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in OESTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from OESTRESC. OESTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for OESTRESC and OESTRESN. Examples: "mm", "um".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Lower end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., OESTRESC, OESTRESN) represented in standardized units (OESTRESU).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Normal Range Lower Limit-Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESTNRLO

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Upper end of normal range or reference range for standardized results (e.g., OESTRESC, OESTRESN) represented in standardized units (OESTRESU).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Normal Range Upper Limit-Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESTNRHI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Normal range or reference range for results stored in OESTRESC that are character in ordinal or categorical scale. Example: "Negative to Trace".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Normal Range for Character Results
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESTNRC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate the value is outside the normal range or reference range. May be defined by OEORNRLO and OEORNRHI or other objective criteria. Examples: "Y", "N"; "HIGH", "LOW"; "NORMAL", "ABNORMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OENRIND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results. Examples: "POSITIVE", "NEGATIVE". The variable OERESCAT is not meant to replace the use of OENRIND for cases where normal ranges are provided.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OERESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OESTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with OESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Filename for an external file, such as one for a retinal OCT image.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: External File Path
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEXFN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "EYE" for a finding record relative to the complete eye, "RETINA" for a measurement or assessment of only the retina.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location Used for the Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OELOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OELAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of). Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT", "MANY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Portion or Totality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEPORTOT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Example: "ETDRS EYE CHART" for OETESTCD = "NUMLCOR". The different methods may offer different functionality or granularity, affecting the set of results and associated meaning.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OELOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that OEBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "INVESTIGATOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in OEEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: In cases where more than one assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response, this flag identifies the record that is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted evaluation. Expected to be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Accepted Record Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEACPTFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The incidence number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Examples: multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Repetition Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEREPNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date/time of the observation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of observation/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OETPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OETPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (OETPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OEELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by OETPT, OETPTNUM, and OEELTM.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OETPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of the reference time point, OETPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OERFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external specimen identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the analyte or specimen characteristic. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "ASA", "VOL", "SPG".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pharmacokinetic Test Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the analyte or specimen characteristic. Note any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in PCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Acetylsalicylic Acid", "Volume", "Specific Gravity".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pharmacokinetic Test Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "ANALYTE", "SPECIMEN PROPERTY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of a test category.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Test Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PCORRES. Example: "mg/L".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from PCORRES in a standard format or standard units. PCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in PCSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in PCORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in PCSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from PCSTRESC. PCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for PCSTRESC and PCSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a result was not obtained. Should be null if a result exists in PCORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a result was not obtained, such as "SPECIMEN LOST". Used in conjunction with PCSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Test Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provides the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Material Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen. Examples: "HEMOLYZED", "ICTERIC", "LIPEMIC".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Condition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCSPCCND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "HPLC/MS", "ELISA". This should contain sufficient information and granularity to allow differentiation of various methods that might have been used within a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Fasting Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCFAST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, which do not come from the CRF, are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If PCDRVFL = "Y", then PCORRES may be null with PCSTRESC, and PCSTRESN (if the result is numeric) having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates the lower limit of quantitation for an assay. Units should be those used in PCSTRESU.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Lower Limit of Quantitation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCLLOQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates the upper limit of quantitation for an assay. Units should be those used in PCSTRESU.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Upper Limit of Quantitation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCULOQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. If there is no end time, then this will be the collection time.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of specimen collection represented in ISO 8601 character format. If there is no end time, the collection time should be stored in PCDTC, and PCENDTC should be null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of specimen collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Actual Study Day of Specimen Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when specimen should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PCTPTNUM and PCTPTREF. Examples: "Start", "5 min post".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of PCTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (PCTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCELTM
