SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point used as a basis for PCTPT, PCTPTNUM, and PCELTM. Example: "MOST RECENT DOSE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of the reference time point described by PCTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Evaluation Interval associated with a PCTEST record represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-PT2H" to represent an evaluation interval of 2 hours prior to a PCTPT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluation Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PCEVLINT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PESEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to link together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PESPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of a part of the body examined in a physical examination. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "HEAD", "ENT". If the results of the entire physical examination are represented in one record, value should be "PHYSEXAM".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Body System Examined Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PETESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name of a part of the body examined in a physical examination. The value in PETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Head", "Ear/Nose/Throat". If the results of the entire physical examination are represented in one record, value should be "Physical Examination".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Body System Examined
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PETEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: If the value of PEORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Modified Reported Term
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEMODIFY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "GENERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PECAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of --CAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Body system or organ class (e.g., MedDRA SOC) that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Body System or Organ Class
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEBODSYS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of any abnormal findings. If the examination was completed and there were no abnormal findings, the value should be "NORMAL". If the examination was not performed on a particular body system, or at the subject level, then the value should be null, and "NOT DONE" should appear in PESTAT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Verbatim Examination Finding
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PEORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: If there are findings for a body system, then either the dictionary preferred term (if findings are coded using a dictionary) or PEORRES (if findings are not encoded) should appear here. If PEORRES is null, PESTRESC must be null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PESTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate exam not done. Must be null if a result exists in PEORRES/PESTRESC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PESTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why an examination was not performed or why a body system was not examined. Example: "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with PESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Examined
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Example: "ARM" for skin rash.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location of Physical Exam Finding
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PELOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterallity. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PELAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: "PALPATION", "PERCUSSION".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PELOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A baseline defined by the sponsor (could be derived in the same manner as PELOBXFL or ABLFL, but is not required to be). The value should be "Y" or null. Note that PEBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Example: "INVESTIGATOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the physical exam finding.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date and time of the physical examination represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of physical exam, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PEDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. \n
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain to support relationships within the domain and between domains.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the pharmacokinetic parameter. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in PPTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). PPTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "AUCALL", "TMAX", "CMAX".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Parameter Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the pharmacokinetic parameter. The value in PPTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "AUC All", "Time of CMAX", "Max Conc".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Parameter Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records. For PP, this should be the name of the analyte in PCTEST whose profile the parameter is associated with.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Parameter Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Categorization of the model type used to calculate the PK parameters. Examples: "COMPARTMENTAL", "NON-COMPARTMENTAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Parameter Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for PPORRES. Example: "ng/L". See PP Assumption 3.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from PPORRES in a standard format or standard units. PPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in PPSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from PPSTRESC. PPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for PPSTRESC and PPSTRESN. See PP Assumption 3.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a parameter was not calculated. Should be null if a result exists in PPORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a parameter was not calculated, such as "INSUFFICIENT DATA". Used in conjunction with PPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Parameter Not Calculated
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. If multiple specimen types are used for a calculation (e.g., serum and urine for renal clearance), then this field should be left blank. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Material Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Analysis method applied to obtain a summarized result. Analysis method describes the method of secondary processing applied to a complex observation result. Example: A named formula used to calculate AUC, such as "LIN-LOG TRAPEZOIDAL METHOD". \n Sponsor-defined formulas can also be represented by this variable. Example: Calculating ratio AUCs where the PPANMETH may be "DRUG METABOLITE 1 TO DRUG PARENT" or "DRUG METABOLITE 2 TO METABOLITE 1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Analysis Method
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPANMETH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time of the observation, or the date/time of collection if start date/time is not collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Nominal date/time of parameter calculations.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Parameter Calculations
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the collection, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Parameter Calculations
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The description of a time point that acts as a fixed reference for a series of planned time points.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of the reference time point from the PC records used to calculate a parameter record. The values in PPRFTDTC should be the same as that in PCRFTDTC for related records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The start of a planned evaluation or assessment interval relative to the time point reference.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPSTINT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The end of a planned evaluation or assessment interval relative to the time point reference.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PPENINT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Question number on a questionnaire.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Topic variable for QS. Short name for the value in QSTEST, which can be used as a column name when converting the dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in QSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). QSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. \n Controlled terminology for QSTESTCD is published in separate codelists for each questionnaire. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/semantics/terminology for values for QSTESTCD. Examples: "ADCCMD01", "BPR0103".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Question Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the question or group of questions used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in QSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n Controlled terminology for QSTEST is published in separate codelists for each questionnaire. See https://www.cdisc.org/standards/semantics/terminology for values for QSTEST. Example: "BPR01 - Emotional Withdrawal".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Question Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to specify the questionnaire in which the question identified by QSTEST and QSTESTCD was included. Examples: "ADAS-COG", "MDS-UPDRS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category of Question
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of the questions within the category. Examples: "MENTAL HEALTH" , "DEPRESSION", "WORD RECALL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Question
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Finding as originally received or collected (e.g., "RARELY", "SOMETIMES"). When sponsors apply codelist to indicate that code values are statistically meaningful standardized scores (which are defined by sponsors or by valid methodologies, e.g., SF36 questionnaires), QSORRES will contain the decode format; QSSTRESC and QSSTRESN may contain the standardized code values or scores.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for QSORRES, such as minutes or seconds or the units associated with a visual analog scale.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the finding for all questions or subscores copied or derived from QSORRES, in a standard format or standard units. QSSTRESC should store all findings in character format; if findings are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in QSSTRESN. If question scores are derived from the original finding, then the standard format is the score. Examples: "0", "1". \n When sponsors apply codelist to indicate the code values are statistically meaningful standardized scores (which are defined by sponsors or by valid methodologies, e.g., SF36 questionnaires), QSORRES will contain the decode format; QSSTRESC and QSSTRESN may contain the standardized code values or scores.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from QSSTRESC. QSSTRESN should store all numeric results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for QSSTRESC or QSSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not done or was not answered. Should be null if a result exists in QSORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a question was not answered. Used in conjunction with QSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE". Example: "SUBJECT REFUSED".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Performed
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that QSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records or questionnaire subscores that do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If QSDRVFL = "Y", then QSORRES may be null with QSSTRESC and (if numeric) QSSTRESN having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the observation date/time of the physical exam finding.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date of questionnaire.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Finding
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of finding collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Finding
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when questionnaire should be administered. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See QSTPTNUM and QSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of QSTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (QSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by QSTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by QSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by QSELTM, QSTPTNUM, and QSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of the reference time point, QSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Evaluation interval associated with a QSTEST question represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-P2Y" to represent an interval of 2 years in the question "Have you experienced any episodes in the past 2 years?".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluation Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSEVLINT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluation Interval Text
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QSEVINTX

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a device.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor Device Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SPDEVID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional internal or external procedure identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RELNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RELNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The value in RETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). RETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "FEV1", "FVC".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Respiratory Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RETESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in RETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second", "Forced Vital Capacity".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Respiratory Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RETEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize observations across subjects.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Respiratory Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RECAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Respiratory Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Position of Subject During Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REPOS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the procedure measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for REORRES and REORREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reference result for continuous measurements in original units. Should be collected only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference Result in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REORREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from REORRES in a standard format or in standard units. RESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RESTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from RESTRESC. RESTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for RESTRESC, RESTRESN and RESTREFN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reference value for the result or finding copied or derived from --ORREF in a standard format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Reference Result
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESTREFC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reference result for continuous measurements in standard units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Reference Result in Std Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESTREFN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a test was not done or a measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in REORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RESTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with RESTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement. Examples: "LUNG", "BRONCHUS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location Used for the Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RELOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Side of the body used to collect measurement. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RELAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method used to create the result.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RELOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be Y or null. Note that REBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. Should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or that do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally collected or received are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If REDRVFL = "Y", then REORRES could be null, with RESTRESC and (if numeric) RESTRESN having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in REEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given time frame for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit). Example: multiple measurements of pulmonary function.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Repetition Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REREPNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of procedure or test.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., "TIME OF LAST DOSE"). See RETPTNUM and RETPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MINUTES POST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RETPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of RETPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RETPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (RETPTREF). Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent 15 minutes prior to the reference time point indicated by RETPTREF, "PT8H" to represent 8 hours after the reference time point represented by RETPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by REELTM, RETPTNUM, and RETPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RETPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RETPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RERFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject (or within a parameter, in the case of the Trial Summary domain). May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Also used to link together a block of related records in the Trial Summary dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional internal or external identifier (e.g., lab specimen ID, UUID for an ECG waveform or a medical image).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: Preprinted line identifier on a CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short character value for RPTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. The short value can be up to 8 characters. Examples: "CHILDPOT", "BCMETHOD", "MENARAGE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Reproductive Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name For RPTESTCD. Examples: "Childbearing Potential", "Birth Control Method", "Menarche Age".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Reproductive Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values. Example: "No use case to date, but values would be relative to reproduction tests grouping".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Reproductive Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of RPCAT values. Example: "No use case to date, but values would be relative to reproduction tests grouping".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Reproductive Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected. Examples: "120", "<1", "POS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for RPORRES. Examples: "in", "LB", "kg/L".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from RPORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. RPSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RPSTRESN. For example, if various tests have results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in RPORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in RPSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from RPSTRESC. RPSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for RPSTRESC and RPSTRESN. Example: "mol/L".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with RPSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that RPBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records which represent the average of other records or which do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If RPDRVFL = "Y", then RPORRES may be null, with RPSTRESC and (if numeric) RPSTRESN having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of an observation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collected duration of an event, intervention, or finding represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Duration
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (RPTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by RPELTM, RPTPTNUM, and RPTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RPTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RPRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: An identifier used to link the response assessment to the related measurement record in another domain which was used to determine the response result. LNKID values group records within USUBJID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A grouping identifier used to link the response assessment to a group of measurement/assessment records which were used in the assessment of the response. LNKGRP values group records within USUBJID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the TEST in RSTEST. The value in RSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). RSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "TRGRESP", "NTRGRESP", "OVRLRESP", "SYMPTDTR", "CPS0102". \n There are separate codelists used for RSTESTCD where the choice depends on the value of RSCAT. Codelist "ONCRTSCD" is used for oncology response criteria (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "ONCRSCAT"). Examples: TRGRESP, "NTRGRESP, "OVRLRESP". For Clinical Classifications (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "CCCAT"), QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Assessment Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the response assessment. The value in RSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. \n There are separate codelists used for RSTEST where the choice depends on the value of RSCAT. Codelist "ONCRTS" is used for oncology response criteria (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "ONCRSCAT"). Examples: "Target Response", "Non-target Response", "Overall Response", "Symptomatic Deterioration". For Clinical Classifications (when RSCAT is a term in codelist "CCCAT"), QRS Naming Rules apply. These instruments have individual dedicated terminology codelists.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Assessment Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects. Examples: "RECIST 1.1", "CHILD-PUGH CLASSIFICATION". There are separate codelists used for RSCAT where the choice depends on whether the related records are about an oncology response criterion or another clinical classification. \n RSCAT is required for clinical classifications other than oncology response criteria.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Assessment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of RSCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the response assessment as originally received, collected, or calculated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for RSORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for the response assessment, copied, or derived from RSORRES in a standard format or standard units. RSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format. \n For Clinical Classifications, this may be a score.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from --STRESC. --STRESN should store all numeric test results or findings. For Clinical Classifications, this may be a score.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for RSSTRESC and RSSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate the response assessment was not performed. Should be null if a result exists in RSORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a response assessment was not performed. Examples: "All target tumors not evaluated", "Subject does not have non-target tumors". Used in conjunction with RSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the response assessment. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null. \n When a clinical classification is assessed at multiple times, including baseline, RSLOBXFL should be included in the dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that --BLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST". \n RSEVAL is expected for oncology response criteria. It can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. However, the column should contain no null values when data from one or more independent assessors is included, meaning that the rows attributed to the investigator should contain a value of "INVESTIGATOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in RSEVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See assumptions in Section 6.3.9.3.1, Disease Response Use Case.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: In cases where more than 1 independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATOR") provides an evaluation of response, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted evaluation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Accepted Record Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSACPTFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of the assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Assessment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the assessment, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Assessment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See RSTPTNUM and RSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 character format relative to a planned fixed reference (RSTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by RSELTM, RSTPTNUM, and RSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by RSTPTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Duration of interval associated with an observation such as a finding RSTESTCD, represented in ISO 8601 character format. Example: "-P2M" to represent a period of the past 2 months as the evaluation interval.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluation Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSEVLINT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Evaluation interval associated with an observation, where the interval is not able to be represented in ISO 8601 format. Examples: "LIFETIME", "LAST NIGHT", "RECENTLY", "OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluation Interval Text
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSEVINTX

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable RSSTTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSTRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by RSSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15", "VISIT 1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSSTTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable RSENTPT. \n Not all values of the codelist are allowable for this variable. See Section 4.4.7, Use of Relative Timing Variables.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSENRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by RSENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25", "VISIT 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSENTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.

SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in SCTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in SCTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). SCTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "MARISTAT", "NATORIG".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subject Characteristic Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in SCTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Marital Status", "National Origin".

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records.

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from SCORRES, in a standard format or standard units. SCSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in SCSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in SCORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in SCSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".

SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from SCSTRESC. SCSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for SCSTRESC or SCSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that the measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in SCORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why the observation has no result. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with SCSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".

SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time at which the assessment was made.

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of the subject characteristic represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of collection, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SCDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier

SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SSSPID

The value in SSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). SSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "SURVSTAT".

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize observations across subjects.

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why an assessment was not performed. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with SSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Assessment Not Performed
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SSREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "CAREGIVER", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "FRIEND".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a scan/image/physical exam was not performed or a tumor/lesion measurement was not taken. Should be null if a result exists in TRORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a scan/image/physical exam was not performed or a tumor/lesion measurement was not taken. Examples: "SCAN NOT PERFORMED", "NOT ASSESSABLE: IMAGE OBSCURED TUMOR". Used in conjunction with TRSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the tumor/lesion measurement or assessment. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method used to measure the tumor/lesion/location of interest. Examples: "MRI", "CT SCAN", "PET SCAN", "Coronary angiography".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method Used to Identify the Tumor/Lesion
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that TRBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TREVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in TREVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See assumption 6.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TREVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: In cases where more than 1 independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE") provide independent assessments at the same time point, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted assessment.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Accepted Record Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRACPTFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the element in the planned sequence of elements for the arm to which the subject was assigned.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The date of the scan/image/physical exam. TRDTC does not represent the date that the image was read to identify tumors/lesions. TRDTC also does not represent the VISIT date.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Tumor/Lesion Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the scan/image/physical exam, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Tumor/Lesion Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TRDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain. Can be used to group split or merged tumors/lesions which have been identified.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external identifier (e.g., medical image ID number).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion/location of interest to the assessment results (in TR domain) over the course of the study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TULNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TULNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the TEST in TUTEST. TUTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters nor can start with a number. TUTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Example: "TUMIDENT". See assumption 3.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test for the tumor/lesion identification. The value in TUTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Tumor identification". See assumption 3.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Test Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the tumor/lesion identification. The result of tumor/lesion identification is a classification of the identified tumor/lesion. Example: When TUTESTCD = "TUMIDENT", values of TUORRES might be "TARGET", "NON-TARGET", "NEW", or "BENIGN ABNORMALITY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Result
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from TUORRES in a standard format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Tumor/Lesion ID Result Std. Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name or identifier of the vendor that performed the tumor/lesion Identification. This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to specify the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion (e.g., "LIVER"). \n Note: When anatomical location is broken down and collected as distinct pieces of data that when combined provide the overall location information (e.g., laterality/directionality/distribution), then additional anatomical location qualifiers should be used. See assumption 3.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location of the Tumor/Lesion
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TULOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality (e.g., "LEFT", "RIGHT", "BILATERAL").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TULAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality (e.g., "UPPER", "INTERIOR").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, or apportioning of. Examples: "ENTIRE", "SINGLE", "SEGMENT", "MULTIPLE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Portion or Totality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUPORTOT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method used to identify the tumor/lesion. Examples: "MRI", "CT SCAN".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Identification
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TULOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that TUBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR". \n This column can be left null when the investigator provides the complete set of data in the domain. However, the column should contain no null values when data from 1 or more independent assessors is included. For example, the rows attributed to the investigator should contain a value of "INVESTIGATOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2". See assumption 9.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: In cases where more than 1 independent assessor (e.g., "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE") provide independent assessments at the same time point, this flag identifies the record that is considered to be the accepted assessment.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Accepted Record Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUACPTFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: TUDTC variable represents the date of the scan/image/physical exam. TUDTC does not represent the date that the image was read to identify tumors. TUDTC also does not represent the VISIT date.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Tumor/Lesion Identification
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the scan/image/physical exam, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Tumor/Lesion Identification
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TUDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. May be any valid number (including decimals) and does not have to start at 1.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional group identifier, used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Optional internal or external identifier (e.g., lab specimen ID, universally unique identifier (UUID) for a medical image).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: Preprinted line identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URLNKID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to link related records across domains. This will usually be a many-to-one relationship.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Link Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URLNKGRP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short character value for URTEST used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical format to a horizontal format. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in URTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). URTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "COUNT", "LENGTH", "RBLDFLW".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Short Name of Urinary Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Long name For URTESTCD. Examples: "Count", "Length", "Renal Blood Flow".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of Urinary Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Further description of URTESTCD and URTEST.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Urinary Test Detail
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URTSTDTL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Urinary Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a further categorization of URCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Urinary Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unit for URORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from URORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. URSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in URSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from URSTRESC. URSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for URSTRESC and URSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to categorize the result of a finding.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URRESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a question was not asked or a test was not done, or a test was attempted but did not generate a result. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reason not done. Used in conjunction with URSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of the measurement.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location Used for the Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality. Examples: "ANTERIOR", "LOWER", "PROXIMAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Directionality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URDIR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of the test or examination.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A baseline defined by the sponsor The value should be "Y" or null. Note that URBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record (e.g., a record that represents the average of other records such as a computed baseline). Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "INDEPENDENT ASSESSOR", "RADIOLOGIST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: UREVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in UREVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST1", "RADIOLOGIST2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: UREVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm for the element in which the observation was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time at which the observation was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of an observation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when a measurement or observation should be taken as defined in the protocol. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See URTPTNUM and URTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numeric version of planned time point used in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URTPTNUM
