SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time relative to a planned fixed reference (URTPTREF; e.g., "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL"). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by URELTM, URTPTNUM, and URTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by URTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: URRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in VSTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in VSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). VSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SYSBP", "DIABP", "BMI".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vital Signs Test Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in VSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Systolic Blood Pressure", "Diastolic Blood Pressure", "Body Mass Index".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vital Signs Test Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Vital Signs
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of a measurement or examination.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Vital Signs
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: "SUPINE", "STANDING", "SITTING".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vital Signs Position of Subject
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSPOS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for VSORRES. Examples: "in", "LB", "beats/min".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from VSORRES in a standard format or standard units. VSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in VSSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in VSORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in VSSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from VSSTRESC. VSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for VSSTRESC and VSSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that a vital sign measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in VSORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: "BROKEN EQUIPMENT", "SUBJECT REFUSED". Used in conjunction with VSSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Performed
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Location relevant to the collection of vital signs measurement. Example: "ARM" for blood pressure.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location of Vital Signs Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. Should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. Should be "Y" or null. Note that VSBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be "Y" or null. Records that represent the average of other records or that do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If VSDRVFL = "Y," then VSORRES may be null, with VSSTRESC and (if numeric) VSSTRESN having the derived value.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Derived Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSDRVFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of toxicity quantified by VSTOXGR. The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Toxicity
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSTOX

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Records toxicity grade value using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2", not "Grade 2"). The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the external codelist element in the Define-XML document.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSTOXGR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether a collected observation is clinically significant based on judgment.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Clinically Significant, Collected
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSCLSIG

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the start date/time at which the assessment was made.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date and time of the vital signs assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Measurements
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of vital signs measurements, measured as integer days. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Vital Signs
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point (e.g., time of last dose). See VSTPTNUM and VSTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of VSTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (VSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 Duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by VSELTM, VSTPTNUM, and VSTPT. Examples: "PREVIOUS DOSE", "PREVIOUS MEAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of the reference time point, VSTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VSRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FASEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FAGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. May be preprinted on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FASPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in FATEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in FATESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). FATESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: "SEV", "OCCUR". Note that controlled terminology is in a FATESTCD general codelist and in several therapeutic area-specific codelists.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Findings About Test Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FATESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in FATEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Severity/Intensity", "Occurrence". Note that controlled terminology is in a FATEST general codelist and in several therapeutic area-specific codelists.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Findings About Test Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FATEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to describe the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by --TEST. Examples: the term (e.g., "Acne") describing a clinical sign or symptom that is being measured by a severity test; an event (e.g., "VOMIT, where the volume of vomit is being measured by a VOLUME test).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Object of the Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FAOBJ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: "GERD", "PRE-SPECIFIED AE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Findings About
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FACAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of FACAT.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Findings About
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FASCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of the test as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FAORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for FAORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FAORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from FAORRES in a standard format or standard units. FASTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in FASTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in FAORRES, and these results effectively have the same meaning; they could be represented in standard format in FASTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FASTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from FASTRESC. FASTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FASTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized unit used for FASTRESC and FASTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FASTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate that the measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in FAORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FASTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a question was not answered. Example: "Subject refused". Used in conjunction with FASTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Performed
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FAREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to specify the location of the clinical evaluation. Example: "ARM".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location of the Finding About
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FALOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FALAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally-derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FALOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that FABLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FABLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FAEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. \n 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. \n 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time of the observation. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", "FOLLOW-UP".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of findings assessment represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FADTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: 1. Study day of collection, measured as integer days. \n 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: FADY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: "Specimen ID".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reference ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRREFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRSPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in SRTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in SRTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). SRTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Skin Response Test or Exam Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRTESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in SRTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Example: "Wheal Diameter".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Skin Response Test or Examination Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRTEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to describe the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by --TEST. Examples: the dose of the immunogenic material or the allergen associated with the response (e.g., "Johnson Grass IgE 0.15 BAU mL").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Object of the Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SROBJ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to define a category of topic-variable values across subjects.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Category for Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of SRCAT values.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subcategory for Test
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRSCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Results of measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Results or Findings in Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRORRES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for SRORRES. Example: "mm".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Original Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRORRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Contains the result value for all findings copied or derived from SRORRES, in a standard format or in standard units. SRSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in SRSTRESN.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRSTRESC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from SRSTRESC. SRSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Numeric Results/Findings in Std. Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRSTRESN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Standardized units used for SRSTRESC and SRSTRESN. Example: "mm".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Standard Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRSTRESU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate exam not done. Should be null if a result exists in SRORRES.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Completion Status
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRSTAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Used in conjunction with SRSTAT when value is "NOT DONE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Not Done
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRREASND

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name or identifier of the laboratory or vendor who provided the test results.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Vendor Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the types of specimen used for a measurement. Example: "SKIN".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRSPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Location relevant to the collection of the measurement.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Location Used for Measurement
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRLOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing laterality of intervention administration. Examples: "RIGHT", "LEFT", "BILATERAL".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Laterality
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRLAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Method of test or examination. Examples: "ELISA", "EIA", "MICRONEUTRALIZATION ASSAY", "PLAQUE REDUCTION NEUTRALIZATION ASSAY".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Method of Test or Examination
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRMETHOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Operationally derived indicator used to identify the last non-missing value prior to RFXSTDTC. The value should be "Y" or null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Last Observation Before Exposure Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRLOBXFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null. Note that SRBLFL is retained for backward compatibility. The authoritative baseline flag for statistical analysis is in an ADaM dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Baseline Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRBLFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of person who provided evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain collected or derived data. Examples: "INVESTIGATOR", "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "VENDOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SREVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the date/time of the observation. Examples: "SCREENING", "TREATMENT", and "FOLLOW-UP".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Collection date and time of an observation represented in ISO 8601.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of visit/collection/exam expressed in integer days relative to sponsor- defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Visit/Collection/Exam
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Text description of time when measurement should be taken. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See SRTPTNUM and SRTPTREF. Examples: "START", "5 MIN POST".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRTPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Numerical version of SRTPT to aid in sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Time Point Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRTPTNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a fixed time point reference (SRTPTREF). Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by EGTPTREF, "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by SRTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRELTM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by SRELTM, SRTPTNUM, and SRTPT. Example: "INTRADERMAL INJECTION".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Time Point Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRTPTREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of the reference time point, SRTPTREF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SRRFTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s). Null for comments collected on a general comments or additional information CRF page.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RDOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: COSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifying variable in the parent dataset that identifies the record(s) to which the comment applies. Examples AESEQ or CMGRPID. Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Identifying Variable
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IDVAR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s). Used only when individual comments are related to domain records. Null for comments collected on separate CRFs.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Identifying Variable Value
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IDVARVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined reference associated with the comment. May be the CRF page number (e.g., 650), or a module name (e.g., DEMOG), or a combination of information that identifies the reference (e.g. 650-VITALS-VISIT 2).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Comment Reference
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: COREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The text of the comment. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns COVAL1-COVALn. See Assumption 3.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Comment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: COVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Role of the person who provided the evaluation. Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Example: "INVESTIGATOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: COEVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in --EVAL. Examples: "RADIOLOGIST", "RADIOLOGIST 1", "RADIOLOGIST 2".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: COEVALID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of comment on dedicated comment form. Should be null if this is a child record of another domain or if comment date was not collected.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Comment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CODTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of the comment, in integer days. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Comment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: CODY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This must be a unique value, and could be a compound identifier formed by concatenating STUDYID-SITEID-SUBJID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reference start date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment. See assumption 9 for additional detail on when RFSTDTC may be null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RFSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Reference end date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to the date/time when subject was determined to have ended the trial, and often equivalent to date/time of last exposure to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subject Reference End Date/Time
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RFENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: First date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the earliest value of EXSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RFXSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Last date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the latest value of EXENDTC (or the latest value of EXSTDTC if EXENDTC was not collected or is missing).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RFXENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used only when protocol specifies a challenge agent to induce a condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Equal to the earliest value of AGSTDTC for the challenge agent.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of First Challenge Agent Admin
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RFCSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used only when protocol specifies a challenge agent to induce a condition that the investigational treatment is intended to cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent. Equal to the latest value of AGENDTC for the challenge agent (or the latest value of AGSTDTC if AGENDTC was not collected or is missing).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Last Challenge Agent Admin
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RFCENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented. Would be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Informed Consent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RFICDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time when subject ended participation or follow-up in a trial, as defined in the protocol, in ISO 8601 character format. Should correspond to the last known date of contact. Examples include completion date, withdrawal date, last follow-up, date recorded for lost to follow up, and death date.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of End of Participation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RFPENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO 8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Death
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DTHDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates the subject died. Should be "Y" or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subject Death Flag
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DTHFL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a site within a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Site Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SITEID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: An identifier to describe the Investigator for the study. May be used in addition to SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Investigator Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: INVID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the investigator for a site.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Investigator Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: INVNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of birth of the subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Birth
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: BRTHDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Age expressed in AGEU. May be derived from RFSTDTC and BRTHDTC, but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Age
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Units associated with AGE.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Age Units
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: AGEU

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sex of the subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sex
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SEX

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to the FDA guidance2 regarding the collection of race. See assumption below regarding RACE.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Race
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RACE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to the FDA guidance1 regarding the collection of ethnicity.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Ethnicity
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ETHNIC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. If the subject was not assigned to a trial arm, ARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Arm Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ARMCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the arm to which the subject was assigned. If the subject was not assigned to an arm, ARM is null and ARMNRS is populated. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Planned Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ARM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Code of actual arm. ACTARMCD is limited to 20 characters. It is not subject to the character restrictions that apply to TESTCD. The maximum length of ACTARMCD is longer than for other short variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARMCD in the Trial Arms dataset. \n If the subject was not assigned to an arm or followed a course not described by any planned arm, ACTARMCD is null and ARMNRS is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Actual Arm Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ACTARMCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of actual arm. \n With the exception of studies which use multistage arm assignments, must be a value of ARM in the Trial Arms dataset. \n If the subject was not assigned to an arm or followed a course not described by any planned arm, ACTARM is null and ARMNRS is populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Actual Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ACTARM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A coded reason that arm variables (ARM and ARMCD) and/or actual arm variables (ACTARM and ACTARMCD) are null. Examples: "SCREEN FAILURE", "NOT ASSIGNED", "ASSIGNED, NOT TREATED", "UNPLANNED TREATMENT". It is assumed that if the arm and actual arm variables are null, the same reason applies to both arm and actual arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason Arm and/or Actual Arm is Null
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ARMNRS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A description of actual treatment for a subject who did not receive treatment described in a planned trial arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Unplanned Actual Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ACTARMUD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Country of the investigational site in which the subject participated in the trial. \n \n Generally represented using ISO 3166-1 Alpha-3. Note that regulatory agency specific requirements (e.g., US FDA) may require other terminologies; in such cases, follow regulatory requirements.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Country
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: COUNTRY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Date/time of demographic data collection.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Date/Time of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DMDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of collection measured as integer days.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Collection
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DMDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. Should be assigned to be consistent chronological order.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SESEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: 1. ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name. \n 2. If an encountered element differs from the planned element to the point that it is considered a new element, then use "UNPLAN" as the value for ETCD to represent this element.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Element Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ETCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name of the element. If ETCD has a value of "UNPLAN", then ELEMENT should be null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ELEMENT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the planned order of the element within the subject's assigned trial arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Epoch associated with the element in the planned sequence of elements for the arm to which the subject was assigned.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time for an element for each subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SESTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time for an element for each subject.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SEENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of start of element relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SESTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of end of element relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SEENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of what happened to the subject during an unplanned element. Used only if ETCD has the value of "UNPLAN".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Unplanned Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SEUPDES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of subject records. Should be assigned to be consistent chronological order.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SMSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the specific disease milestone. For types of disease milestones that can occur multiple times, the name will end with a sequence number. Example: "HYPO1".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Disease Milestone Instance Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIDS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The type of disease milestone. Example: "HYPOGLYCEMIC EVENT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Disease Milestone Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIDSTYPE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of milestone instance (if milestone is an intervention or event) or date of milestone (if Milestone is a finding).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Milestone
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SMSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of disease milestone instance.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Milestone
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SMENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of start of disease milestone instance, relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Milestone
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SMSTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study day of end of disease milestone instance, relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Milestone
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SMENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain most relevant to the observation. The domain abbreviation is also used as a prefix for variables to ensure uniqueness when datasets are merged.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to indicate whether the visit was planned (i.e., visits specified in the TV domain). Value is "Y" for planned visits, null for unplanned visits.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pre-specified
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVPRESP

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to record whether a planned visit occurred. The value is null for unplanned visits.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Occurrence
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVOCCUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The reason for the value in SVOCCUR. If SVOCCUR="N", SVREASOC is the reason the visit did not occur.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Reason for Occur Value
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVREASOC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The way in which the visit was conducted. Examples: "IN PERSON", "TELEPHONE CALL", "IVRS".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Contact Mode
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVCNTMOD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates whether the visit was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVEPCHGI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Start date/time of an observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Start Date/Time of Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVSTDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: End date/time of the observation represented in IS0 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: End Date/Time of Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVENDTC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of start of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of Start of Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVSTDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Actual study day of end of observation expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Day of End of Observation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVENDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of what happened to the subject during an unplanned visit. Only populated for unplanned visits.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Unplanned Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SVUPDES

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than that for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Arm Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ARMCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name given to an arm or treatment group.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Planned Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ARM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Number that gives the order of the element within the arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Order of Element within Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TAETORD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Element Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ETCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name of the element. The same element may occur more than once within an arm.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ELEMENT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Condition subject met, at a "branch" in the trial design at the end of this element, to be included in this arm (e.g., "Randomization to DRUG X").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Branch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TABRANCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: If the trial design allows a subject to transition to an element other than the next element in sequence, then the conditions for transitioning to those other elements, and the alternative element sequences, are specified in this rule (e.g., "Responders go to washout").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Transition Rule
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TATRANS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the trial epoch with which this element of the arm is associated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Epoch
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: EPOCH

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A number given to ensure ordinal sequencing of the planned assessment schedules within a trial.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence of Planned Assessment Schedule
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TDORDER

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A reference to the date variable name that provides the start point from which the planned disease assessment schedule is measured. This must be a referenced from the ADaM ADSL dataset (e.g., "ANCH1DT"). Note: TDANCVAR will contain the name of a reference date variable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Anchor Variable Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TDANCVAR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A fixed offset from the date provided by the variable referenced in TDANCVAR. This is used when the timing of planned cycles does not start on the exact day referenced in the variable indicated in TDANCVAR. The value of this variable will be either zero or a positive value and will be represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Offset from the Anchor
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TDSTOFF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Assessment Interval
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TDTGTPAI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The lower limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Assessment Interval Minimum
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TDMINPAI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The upper limit of the allowed range for the planned interval between disease assessments represented in ISO 8601 character format.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Assessment Interval Maximum
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TDMAXPAI

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: This variable must represent the maximum number of actual assessments for the analysis that this disease assessment schedule describes. In a trial where the maximum number of assessments is not defined explicitly in the protocol (e.g., assessments occur until death), TDNUMRPT should represent the maximum number of disease assessments that support the efficacy analysis encountered by any subject across the trial at that point in time.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Maximum Number of Actual Assessments
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TDNUMRPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: ETCD (the companion to ELEMENT) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that ETCD will need to serve as a variable name.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Element Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ETCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name of the element.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ELEMENT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes condition for beginning element.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Rule for Start of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TESTRL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes condition for ending element. Either TEENRL or TEDUR must be present for each element.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Rule for End of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TEENRL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned duration of element in ISO 8601 format. Used when the rule for ending the element is applied after a fixed duration.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Duration of Element
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TEDUR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name IETEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in IETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). IETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. The prefix "IE" is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Incl/Excl Criterion Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IETESTCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Full text of the inclusion or exclusion criterion. The prefix "IE" is used to ensure consistency with the IE domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IETEST

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used for categorization of the inclusion or exclusion criteria.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Category
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IECAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: A further categorization of the exception criterion. Can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or to categorize as major or minor exceptions. Examples: "MAJOR", "MINOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Subcategory
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IESCAT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Rule that expresses the criterion in computer-executable form. See Assumption 4.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Inclusion/Exclusion Criterion Rule
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TIRL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The number of this version of the Inclusion/Exclusion criteria. May be omitted if there is only 1 version.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Protocol Criteria Versions
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TIVERS

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain, which must be TM.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The type of disease milestone. Example: "HYPOGLYCEMIC EVENT".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Disease Milestone Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: MIDSTYPE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Definition of the disease milestone.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Disease Milestone Definition
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TMDEF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Indicates whether this is a disease milestone that can occur only once ("N") or a type of disease milestone that can occur multiple times ("Y").
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Disease Milestone Repetition Indicator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TMRPT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness within a parameter. Allows inclusion of multiple records for the same TSPARMCD.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSSEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used to tie together a group of related records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Group ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSGRPID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: TSPARMCD (the companion to TSPARM) is limited to 8 characters and does not have special character restrictions. These values should be short for ease of use in programming, but it is not expected that TSPARMCD will need to serve as variable names. Examples: "AGEMIN", "AGEMAX".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Trial Summary Parameter Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSPARMCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Term for the trial summary parameter. The value in TSPARM cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: "Planned Minimum Age of Subjects", "Planned Maximum Age of Subjects".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Trial Summary Parameter
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSPARM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Value of TSPARM. Example: "ASTHMA" when TSPARM value is "Trial Indication". TSVAL can only be null when TSVALNF is populated. Text over 200 characters can be added to additional columns TSVAL1-TSVALn. See Assumption 8.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Parameter Value
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Null flavor for the value of TSPARM, to be populated only if TSVAL is null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Parameter Value Null Flavor
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSVALNF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: This is the code of the term in TSVAL. For example, "6CW7F3G59X" is the code for gabapentin; "C49488" is the code for Y. The length of this variable can be longer than 8 to accommodate the length of the external terminology.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Parameter Value Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSVALCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The name of the reference terminology from which TSVALCD is taken. For example; CDISC CT, SNOMED, ISO 8601.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Name of the Reference Terminology
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSVCDREF

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The version number of the reference terminology, if applicable.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Version of the Reference Terminology
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TSVCDVER

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITNUM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Description of clinical encounter. This is often defined in the protocol. Used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY as a text description of the clinical encounter.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISIT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Due to its sequential nature, used for sorting.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: VISITDY

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: 1. ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a 7-period crossover were constructed using 2-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20. \n 2. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which arm a subject is in, then ARMCD should be null.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Planned Arm Code
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ARMCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: 1. Name given to an arm or treatment group. \n 2. If the timing of visits for a trial does not depend on which arm a subject is in, then Arm should be left blank.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Description of Planned Arm
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: ARM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Rule describing when the visit starts, in relation to the sequence of elements.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit Start Rule
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TVSTRL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Rule describing when the visit ends, in relation to the sequence of elements.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Visit End Rule
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: TVENRL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: DOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism. NHOID should be populated with an intuitive name based on the identity of the organism as reported by the lab. It must be unique for each unique organism as defined by the specific values of the organism's entire known taxonomy described by pairs of OIPARMCD and OIVAL .
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Non-host Organism Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: NHOID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Sequence number to given to ensure uniqueness within a parameter within an organism (NHOID) within dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Sequence Number
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OISEQ

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Short name of the taxon being described. Examples: "GROUP", "GENTYP", "SUBTYP".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Non-host Organism ID Element Short Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OIPARMCD

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the taxon being described. Examples: "Group", "Genotype", "Subtype".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Non-host Organism ID Element Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OIPARM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Value for the taxon in OIPARMCD/OIPARM for the organism identified by NHOID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Non-host Organism ID Element Value
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: OIVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RDOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Name of the identifying variable in the general-observation-class dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ, --GRPID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Identifying Variable
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IDVAR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Value of identifying variable described in IDVAR. If --SEQ is the variable being used to describe this record, then the value of --SEQ would be entered here.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Identifying Variable Value
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IDVARVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the hierarchical level of the records in the relationship. Values should be either "ONE" or "MANY". Used only when identifying a relationship between datasets (as described in Section 8.3, Relating Datasets).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Relationship Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RELTYPE

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique value within USUBJID that identifies the relationship. All records for the same USUBJID that have the same RELID are considered related/associated. RELID can be any value the sponsor chooses, and is only meaningful within the RELREC dataset to identify the related/associated domain records.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Relationship Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RELID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Specimen identifier, unique within USUBJID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen ID
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: REFID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: "SERUM", "PLASMA", "URINE", "SOFT TISSUE".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Type
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SPEC

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the REFID of the parent of a specimen to support tracking its genealogy.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Parent
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: PARENT

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifies the generation number of the sample where the collected sample is considered the first generation.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Specimen Level
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: LEVEL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Unique identifier for a study.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to identify a pool of subjects. If POOLID is entered, POOLDEF records must exist for each subject in the pool and USUBJID must be null. Either USUBJID or POOLID must be populated.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Pool Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: POOLID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to identify a related subject or pool of subjects. RSUBJID will be populated with either the USUBJID of the related subject or the POOLID of the related pool.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Related Subject or Pool Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RSUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Describes the relationship of the subject identified in USUBJID or the pool identified in POOLID to the subject or pool identified in RSUBJID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Subject Relationship
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: SREL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Study identifier of the parent record(s).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Study Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: STUDYID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain of the parent record(s).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Related Domain Abbreviation
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: RDOMAIN

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This is the value of USUBJID in the parent record(s).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Unique Subject Identifier
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: USUBJID

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Identifying variable in the dataset that identifies the related record(s). Examples: --SEQ, --GRPID.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Identifying Variable
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IDVAR

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Value of identifying variable of the parent record(s).
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Identifying Variable Value
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: IDVARVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: The short name of the qualifier variable, which is used as a column name in a domain view with data from the parent domain. The value in QNAM cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). QNAM cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. This will often be the column name in the sponsor's operational dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Qualifier Variable Name
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QNAM

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: This is the long name or label associated with QNAM. The value in QLABEL cannot be longer than 40 characters. This will often be the column label in the sponsor's original dataset.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Qualifier Variable Label
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QLABEL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Result of, response to, or value associated with QNAM. A value for this column is required; no records can be in SUPP-- with a null value for QVAL.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Data Value
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QVAL

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Because QVAL can represent a mixture of collected (on a CRF), derived, or assigned items, QORIG is used to indicate the origin of this data. Examples: "CRF", "Assigned", "Derived". See Section 4.1.8, Origin Metadata.
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Origin
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QORIG

SDTM_VARIABLE.description: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). Should be null for records that contain objectively collected or derived data. Examples: "ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE", "STATISTICIAN", "DATABASE ADMINISTRATOR", "CLINICAL COORDINATOR".
SDTM_VARIABLE.label: Evaluator
SDTM_VARIABLE.name: QEVAL
